title: MEP Technician
description: Responsibilities Install, maintain, and repair MEP systems, including HVAC, electrical systems, and plumbing. Troubleshoot and diagnose malfunctions in MEP equipment and systems. Conduct routine inspections and preventative maintenance on MEP systems. Interpret blueprints, schematics, and technical manuals. Ensure compliance with all relevant safety regulations and company procedures. Collaborate effectively with other technicians and project team members. Maintain accurate records of work performed and materials used. Report any issues or concerns to the supervisor in a timely manner. Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in MEP technology and practices. Qualifications Proven experience as an MEP Technician. Strong understanding of MEP systems, including HVAC, electrical, and plumbing. Ability to read and interpret blueprints, schematics, and technical manuals. Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills. Strong commitment to safety and quality. Ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team. Good communication and interpersonal skills. Relevant certifications or qualifications in MEP trades are desirable. Qureos

title: Speech-Language Pathologist
description: About the job Speech-Language PathologistJob Title: Speech-Language Pathologist (SLP) ﻿Location: Muscat, OmanJob SummaryOur client is seeking a licensed and compassionate Speech-Language Pathologist to join their team. The successful candidate will be responsible for evaluating, diagnosing, and treating individuals with communication and swallowing disorders. This role requires strong clinical skills, excellent communication abilities, and a passion for working with diverse populations.Key Responsibilities- Conduct comprehensive evaluations to identify communication and swallowing disorders in individuals of all ages.- Develop and implement personalized treatment plans to address specific communication and swallowing needs.- Provide speech, language, and swallowing therapy to individuals, groups, and families.- Work closely with multidisciplinary teams, including healthcare professionals, educators, and family members to ensure comprehensive care.- Educate patients, families, and caregivers about communication and swallowing disorders, treatment options, and strategies for support.- Maintain accurate and detailed patient records, including assessment results, treatment plans, and progress notes.Requirements- Master's degree in Speech-Language Pathology or a related field.- Certificate of Clinical Competence in Speech-Language Pathology (CCC-SLP) from the American Speech-Language-Hearing Association (ASHA).- State licensure as a Speech-Language Pathologist (requirements may vary by state). ﻿﻿- Ability to work effectively with individuals, families, and multidisciplinary teams.- Previous experience working with diverse populations and age groups preferred. Leading Edge

title: ICSE Social Science Tutor
description: Filo is the world’s only live instant tutoring app where students are connected with expert tutors in less than 60 seconds for 1-1, interactive video sessions. Filo works 24*7 and the tutors are always available to explain, help, solve, in short, do whatever it takes to assist the student in that very moment. More than 1.5 million students across 15+ countries are using Filo to make their everyday learning better. Currently, there are 50,000+ tutors on Filo which makes it the largest community of tutors in the world.As a company, we are an emerging youth-oriented e-learning startup that thrives on problem-solving capability and a positive attitude. As a team, we are on a mission to democratise education and make quality learning accessible for every student around the world.The Role This is a part-time remote role for an Online Tutor at Filo. The Online Tutor will conduct interactive video tutoring sessions with students, assist in explaining concepts, solving problems, and ensuring students' understanding. Tutors will leverage Filo's platform to provide personalized support and guidance to students in various subjects. Ideal ProfileQualifications Strong communication and interpersonal skills Expertise in subject matter being taught Experience in conducting online tutoring sessions Ability to explain concepts clearly and effectively Patience and adaptability in teaching methods Comfortable with technology and online educational tools Previous teaching or tutoring experience is a plus Bachelor's degree in the relevant field What's on Offer? Work within a company with a solid track record of success Attractive salary & benefits Flexible working options Filo

title: Chief Accountant
description: Company DescriptionA luxury hospitality brand for modern travellers, Anantara connects guests to genuine places, people and stories through personal experiences and providing heartfelt hospitality in the world’s most exciting destinations. From pristine islands and tropical beaches to cosmopolitan cities, tranquil deserts and lush jungles, Anantara welcomes guests for journeys rich in discovery.Job Description Meet accounting financial objectives by forecasting requirements; preparing an annual budget; scheduling expenditures; analyzing variances; initiating corrective actions Confirm financial status by monitoring revenue and expenses; coordinating the collection, consolidation, and evaluation of financial data; preparing special reports Maintain accounting controls by establishing a chart of accounts; defining accounting policies and procedures Conduct and report financial analysis of business performance to ensure company’s financial stability and assist in driving business strategy Lead business strategy to deliver on Financial KPIs, working capital, and full ownership of P&L Responsible and lead contribute end-to-end timely and accurate financial reporting process from record compilation, month end close reconciliation, result analytics, internal and external reporting Ensure all financial transactions are systemically and regularly recorded, accounted for and reconciled vs. budgets Conduct research and identify analysis and recommendation / solutions to business problems Improve systems, work procedures and initiate corrective actions Manage relationships with stakeholders, auditors as well as guide other departments by researching and interpreting accounting policy; applying observations and recommendations to operational issues Other ad-hoc/assignments. Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting Excellent in English Communication in both written and verbal Effective Communication At least 7 years of experience in Auditing/Accounting Anantara

title: Senior Lecturer/Assistant Professor in PE
description: We are seeking a highly qualified and dedicated individual to join our esteemed institution as Senior Lecturer/Assistant Professor in Process Engineering. The successful candidate will contribute to our academic community by delivering high-quality instruction, engaging in research activities, and providing academic advising to students. Courses to be taught cover all aspects of process engineering.Learning and Teaching: High levels of student achievement and satisfaction in under- graduate courses as well as in thesis co-supervision; Delivery of well-designed short courses and/or courses; Well delivered lectures, tutorials, laboratories and/or other forms of interactions with students, which demonstrate cultural awareness and corresponding pedagogy; Evidence of implementing student-centered approaches to learning; Evidence of implementing reflective practices in own teaching; Contributions to the scholarship of learning, at national level (reflective work on teaching and learning that results in improvement to practice - communication of good practice to a wider audience) Research and Consultancy: Contributing to the development of research and/or consultancy proposals that are aligned with the University's mission and strategy; Building research capacity by training and co-supervising young researchers; Participation in multidisciplinary research; Participation in collaborative work with other universities, in Oman and abroad; Timely delivery of quality outcomes and achieving recognition at national and international level; Leadership, community services and administration: Contributions towards the achievement of strategic goals of the University, with a focus on excellence in Learning & Teaching, Research & Consultancy and interaction with stakeholders; Evidence of promoting the values of the University, especially multicultural awareness and ethical practices; Contributions to knowledge transfer with the wider community; Contributions to the promotion of a culture of excellence, by implementing effective and robust quality assurance processes; Course coordination. Specific requirements / Qualification: PhD in Process or Chemical or Petroleum Engineering or a closely related Engineering discipline. Undergraduate qualification in Process or Chemical or Petroleum Engineering or a closely related Engineering discipline. Ability and interest to teach in the areas of Chemical Reaction Engineering, Fluid Dynamics and Petroleum and Petrochemical Processes. Proven research track record in Scopus-indexed journals and/or book series and substantiated capability for independent research and supervising students and junior research staff. Excellent command of English. 3 years of Post-PhD experience is a minimum requirement for the role of Assistant Professor. Teaching experience in English-speaking higher education institutes is a plus. GUtech

title: OQGN, Sr Technician Mechanical - Sohar
description: Job titleSr. Technician MechanicalPosition LevelLevel 8FunctionOperationsDepartmentOperations and MaintenanceLocationOmanBudget control*OPEX or CAPEX or Revenue amount as relevant*Reporting toSupervisor MechanicalDirect reportsNAJob purposeExecute and operate the mechanical maintenance operations activities assigned within the designated area under the authority of the Supervisor Mechanical. Responsible for ensuring the integrity of facilities, providing technical operational support and analysis while maintaining the mechanical operations expenditures. Responsible for maximizing plant operational efficiency, reliability, and safety to meet the requirements and needs of respective business stakeholders.The position will act as the organization's mission, vision, values, policies, and guidelines, supported by an IT technology platform, HSE standards, Oman government and other legal justifications and best international practices aligned with national objectivesMandate QHSSE Obligations Ensure compliance with the HSE Management System. Monitor and report safety performance and compliance. Guide, advise, communicate, and enforce safe behavioural practices (Life Saving Rules, Process Safety Rules) to perform tasks safely. Mandate Culture ObligationsHolding this role and contributing as a valuable member of our community, it is your responsibility to maintain OQGN's cultural principles, fostering growth and facilitating valuable contributions that will contribute to our organization's long-term success.Main tasks and responsibilities Manage task distribution within the team for planned, and unplanned, shutdowns, and turnarounds involving pipeline and static equipment, including tanks, vessels, and valves, ensuring safe and efficient execution. Provide commissioning support for major and minor projects and develop and review repair procedures and checklists for static equipment according to technical standards. Maintain and update all mechanical drawings to reflect modifications, ensure safety-critical elements are reported as per standards, and oversee mechanical equipment maintenance, including control valves and pumps. Coordinate closely with Operations and central maintenance teams for routine and troubleshooting tasks and lead the team in executing refinery maintenance plans for static equipment. Attend internal meetings to resolve issues related to static maintenance, conduct engineering studies for troubleshooting, and provide input for maintenance contracts and administration. Implement and execute the Preventive Maintenance (PM) plan, participate in HAZID, HAZOP, and Design Reviews, and manage material and spare part withdrawals in SAP. Oversee the execution of planned maintenance activities, coordinate master data and maintenance plans in SAP, and conduct toolbox meetings and risk assessments to establish work scope and safety requirements. Coordinate with the reliability team and manage the maintenance and upkeep of all rotary equipment in the assigned area to ensure maximum reliability and availability. Attend internal meetings with Operations, TSD, Planning, and other departments to discuss, resolve issues, prioritize work, and provide input for maintenance contracts, technical evaluations, and procurement plans. Oversee the execution of planned maintenance activities, ensure that maintenance history and reports are updated in SAP, and ensure that all activities are completed according to best practices and schedules. Identify critical issues and repetitive failures, perform Root Cause Analysis (RCA), implement recommendations, and manage work backlogs. Attend daily meetings and coordinate with Operations, TSD, Planning, HSE, and other departments to ensure effective maintenance and continuous improvement, including analyzing reliability reports and recommending changes to site-wide strategies. Implement and approve maintenance processes, ensuring the detection and mitigation of risks, and support the maintenance team in managing critical issues, bad actors, and work backlogs. Review and approve maintenance procedures, support maintenance contracts and shutdowns, and lead the implementation of advanced machinery learning techniques to predict equipment performance and enhance reliability. Key interactions Internal: Gas Network staff External: Staffing specialized Contractors, Vendors & Suppliers Working ConditionsField operations and office environment, moderate to intensive computer screen use.Education requirementsDiploma Degree or equivalent.LanguagePreferable English and ArabicExperience and backgroundFrom 3 to 5 years of experience in operations and maintenance preferably in the oil and gas sectors.Competencies and skillsPrinciples: Strategic Alignment: Ensure that every action and decision will support the organization's long-term goals and objectives. Transparency in Responsibility: Ability to create clear reporting systems to enhance operational efficiency and overall effectiveness. Continuous Improvement: Foster a culture of innovation and learning to adapt and grow in a changing environment. Sustainability: Ability to meet the current business needs by compromising skills with the future generations' needs, balancing environmental, social, and economic concerns within the organization's communities. Diversity and Inclusion: Foster diversity within the workforce and promote an inclusive culture by engaging with a broad array of perspectives and talents. Stakeholder Engagement: Actively involve and communicate with stakeholders to build trust and maintain strong relationships. Soft Skills: Knowledge of maintenance best practices. Acute Observation, Inspection, and problem-solving. Technical Reporting writing. Effective communication, investigations, and system troubleshooting. Technical Skills: Computerized Maintenance Management Systems (CMMS) Maintenance strategies Root Cause Analysis (RCA) Proficient at interpreting technical drawings (P&ID, PFD, SOP, DCS, TLAS) systems Process Safety management Ability to work with computer-based Business Applications (SAP) Operations processes, static and rotating equipment, and technical procedures Job Req ID: 56490Date: Jun 17, 2025Location:Sohar, OMEntity: OQ Gas Networks SAOCBusiness Unit: OQGNDivision: OperationsCountry/Region: OM OQ

description: Job titleSr Operator AssetPosition LevelLevel 8FunctionOperationsDepartmentOperations and MaintenanceLocationOmanBudget control*OPEX or CAPEX or Revenue amount as relevant*Reporting toSupervisor OperationsDirect reportsNAJob purposeExecute and operate the operations and maintenance activities assigned within the designated area under the authority of the Supervisor Operations. Responsible for ensuring the integrity of facilities, providing technical operational support and analysis while maintaining operating expenditures. Responsible for maximizing plant operational efficiency, reliability, and safety to meet the requirements and needs of respective business stakeholders.The position will act as the organization's mission, vision, values, policies, and guidelines, supported by an IT technology platform, HSSE standards, Oman government and other legal justifications and best international practices aligned with national objectives.Mandate QHSSE Obligations Ensure compliance with the HSSE Management System. Monitor and report safety performance and compliance. Guide, advise, communicate, and enforce safe behavioural practices (Life Saving Rules, Process Safety Rules) to perform tasks safely. Mandate Culture ObligationsHolding this role and contributing as a valuable member of our community, it is your responsibility to maintain OQGN's cultural principles, fostering growth and facilitating valuable contributions that will contribute to our organization's long-term success.Main tasks and responsibilities Ensure continuity of operations by addressing issues promptly and taking necessary actions. Conduct detailed routine inspections of all rotating and static equipment to ensure proper functioning both individually and in synchronization with other equipment. Make operational adjustments to valves and switches controlling fluid/gas flow rates, levels, pressure, temperature, and chemicals, and contribute to troubleshooting process upsets and abnormalities. Regularly record field data by reading gauges and instruments on plant equipment, and log significant deviations from standard operating conditions. Facilitate shutdowns and start-ups for turnarounds, maintenance, and inspections in adherence to Standard Operating Procedures (SOP& EOP). Provide support during emergencies as per SOPs and instructions from the Shift Team Leader/Operation Supervisor and Panel Operator, and ensure a safe working environment by isolating, depressurizing, and draining equipment. Ensure compliance with Permit to Work (PTW) conditions, follow up on the progress and completion of maintenance work, and perform minor maintenance tasks such as greasing and bolt tightening. Maintain proper housekeeping and basic equipment care in assigned areas and provide insights on key variances and trends to the Operation Supervisor for significant items and actions. Collaborate effectively to achieve function objectives, performance metrics, quality measures, and budget targets, and foster business continuity and growth through quality improvement initiatives. Draft correspondence and documentation on behalf of the Operation Supervisor, maintain and update key contact databases, and enhance relations with internal and external stakeholders. Establish, implement and supervise all maintenance activities at GSSs, PLSs, Compressor stations, BVSs and Pipelines. Operate the facilities safely and efficiently to ensure 100% availability. Direct and supervise day-to-day operation activities in gas supply stations, and compressor stations ensuring all mandatory checks are performed, consumables are adequately stocked, and liquids are topped up. Ensure all mandatory daily, weekly, monthly and yearly reports and readings are submitted and logged in time Ensure all mandatory FLM checks are completed as per frequency. Ensure that all GTF-related static and rotating equipment is operated and maintained as per the vendor's recommendations Attend callouts as required. Prepare and carry out any isolation, de-isolation, venting, purging, commissioning, and mothballing of pipelines and other GTF facilities as required. Ensure public safety and gas deliverability by maintaining the functionality and integrity of the facilities. Ensure operations activities at the facilities are performed by established Company Quality procedures, HSSE Codes and standards and recognized industry standards Ensure required work on all GTF facilities is completed in a safe, timely and efficient manner and by all required codes, practices, standards and procedures. Examine all Permits to Work for all work carried out by either OQGN, contractor and/or any sub-contractor within GTF facilities for approval of Operation Supervisor. Ensure that the PTW system is followed, and all safety regulations are adhered to. Ensure all necessary forms and documentation are completed and approved as required before, during and after operation activities. Ensure that records systems, engineering drawings and operations databases are kept updated. Constantly review terminals, stations and pipelines for improvements in operability, reliability, safety and integrity and provide written feedback to the Operation Supervisor. Communicate with the Operation Supervisor regularly regarding planned and unplanned work at all stations. Ensure all necessary tools and test equipment are available and operational. Assist in resolving any terminal and station operations issues Provide leadership, mentoring and training to operators. Commissioning of new facilities as required from time to time by established standards and procedures. Provide immediate reporting to the Operation Supervisor regarding any HSSE incident, accident, and non-conformances involving company staff, sub-contractor staff and/or any company facilities and equipment. Implement all Quality and HSSE requirements coming under your area of authority Conduct regular inspections of all GSS, PLS, BVS and Compressor stations and prepare reports by established inspection cycles and procedures. title: Learning & Development Supervisor (Omani Only)
description: Conduct stand-up training to groups of employees. Assist with orientation of new employees. Assist in training hiring managers and interviewers on all interview and selection policies and procedures. Schedule and coordinate applicant interviews with appropriate hiring manager and/or interviewer. Conduct applicant interviews for hourly and management positions. Ensure company grooming standards are communicated effectively to all new employees. Conduct new hire orientation training including completing all new hire paperwork. Assist with design and development of training programs. Develop training aids and multi-media tools to present training material. Order and manage inventory of training materials and supplies. Prepare for training classes (e.g., materials, setup classes, breakdown classes).Follow all company and safety and security policies and procedures. Ensure uniform and personal appearance are clean and professional; maintain confidentiality of proprietary information. Speak with others using clear and professional language; prepare and review written documents accurately and completely. Develop and maintain positive working relationships with others; support team to reach common goals; listen and respond appropriately to the concerns of other employees. Welcome and acknowledge all guests according to company standards; anticipate and address guests' service needs; assist individuals with disabilities; thank guests with genuine appreciation. Ensure adherence to quality expectations and standards. Move, lift, carry, push, pull, and place objects weighing less than or equal to 50 pounds without assistance. Stand, sit, or walk for an extended period of time or for an entire. Perform other reasonable job duties as requested by Supervisors.PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONSEducation: High school diploma or G.E.D. equivalent.Related Work Experience: At least 1 year of related work experience.Supervisory Experience: No supervisory experience.License or Certification: NoneAt Marriott International, we are dedicated to being an equal opportunity employer, welcoming all and providing access to opportunity. title: F&B Service Expert
description: Our jobs aren't just about putting food on the table that our guests will enjoy until they ask for their bill. Instead, we want to build an experience that is memorable and unique - with food and drinks on the side. Our Guest Service Experts take the initiative and deliver a wide range of services to make sure that guests enjoy their meal. Whether setting tables, communicating with the kitchen, interacting and serving guests, or cleaning work areas and supplies, the Guest Service Expert makes transactions feel like part of the experience.No matter what position you are in, there are a few things that are critical to success - creating a safe workplace, following company policies and procedures, upholding quality standards, and ensuring your uniform, personal appearance, and communications are professional. Guest Service Experts will be on their feet and moving around (stand, sit, or walk for an extended time; moving over sloping, uneven, or slippery surfaces), managing the menu (read and visually verify information), and taking a hands-on approach to work (move, lift, carry, push, pull, and place objects weighing less than or equal to 25 pounds without assistance and 50 pounds with assistance; reach overhead and below the knees, including bending, twisting, pulling, and stooping). Doing all these things well (and other reasonable job duties as requested) is critical for Guest Service Experts - to get it right for our guests and our business each and every time.PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONSEducation: High school diploma or G.E.D. equivalent.Related Work Experience: Less than 1 year related work experience.Supervisory Experience: No supervisory experience.License or Certification: NoneAt Marriott International, we are dedicated to being an equal opportunity employer, welcoming all and providing access to opportunity. We actively foster an environment where the unique backgrounds of our associates are valued and celebrated. Our greatest strength lies in the rich blend of culture, talent, and experiences of our associates. We are committed to non-discrimination on any protected basis, including disability, veteran status, or other basis protected by applicable law.When you join the Sheraton family, you become a member of its global community. We've been a place to gather and connect since 1937. At Sheraton, associates create a sense of belonging in more than 400 communities around the world. We invite, we welcome, and we connect guests through engaging experiences and thoughtful service. If you're a team player who is excited to deliver a meaningful guest experience, we encourage you to explore your next career opportunity with Sheraton. Join us on our mission to be 'The World's Gathering Place'. In joining Sheraton Hotels & Resorts, you join a portfolio of brands with Marriott International. Be where you can do your best work,​ begin your purpose, belong to an amazing global​ team, and become the best version of you. Sheraton

title: OQGN, Sr Technician Mechanical - Muscat
description: Job titleSr. Technician MechanicalPosition LevelLevel 8FunctionOperationsDepartmentOperations and MaintenanceLocationOmanBudget control*OPEX or CAPEX or Revenue amount as relevant*Reporting toSupervisor MechanicalDirect reportsNAJob purposeExecute and operate the mechanical maintenance operations activities assigned within the designated area under the authority of the Supervisor Mechanical. Responsible for ensuring the integrity of facilities, providing technical operational support and analysis while maintaining the mechanical operations expenditures. Responsible for maximizing plant operational efficiency, reliability, and safety to meet the requirements and needs of respective business stakeholders.The position will act as the organization's mission, vision, values, policies, and guidelines, supported by an IT technology platform, HSE standards, Oman government and other legal justifications and best international practices aligned with national objectivesMandate QHSSE Obligations Ensure compliance with the HSE Management System. Monitor and report safety performance and compliance. Guide, advise, communicate, and enforce safe behavioural practices (Life Saving Rules, Process Safety Rules) to perform tasks safely. Mandate Culture ObligationsHolding this role and contributing as a valuable member of our community, it is your responsibility to maintain OQGN's cultural principles, fostering growth and facilitating valuable contributions that will contribute to our organization's long-term success.Main tasks and responsibilities Manage task distribution within the team for planned, and unplanned, shutdowns, and turnarounds involving pipeline and static equipment, including tanks, vessels, and valves, ensuring safe and efficient execution. Provide commissioning support for major and minor projects and develop and review repair procedures and checklists for static equipment according to technical standards. Maintain and update all mechanical drawings to reflect modifications, ensure safety-critical elements are reported as per standards, and oversee mechanical equipment maintenance, including control valves and pumps. Coordinate closely with Operations and central maintenance teams for routine and troubleshooting tasks and lead the team in executing refinery maintenance plans for static equipment. Attend internal meetings to resolve issues related to static maintenance, conduct engineering studies for troubleshooting, and provide input for maintenance contracts and administration. Implement and execute the Preventive Maintenance (PM) plan, participate in HAZID, HAZOP, and Design Reviews, and manage material and spare part withdrawals in SAP. Oversee the execution of planned maintenance activities, coordinate master data and maintenance plans in SAP, and conduct toolbox meetings and risk assessments to establish work scope and safety requirements. Coordinate with the reliability team and manage the maintenance and upkeep of all rotary equipment in the assigned area to ensure maximum reliability and availability. Attend internal meetings with Operations, TSD, Planning, and other departments to discuss, resolve issues, prioritize work, and provide input for maintenance contracts, technical evaluations, and procurement plans. Oversee the execution of planned maintenance activities, ensure that maintenance history and reports are updated in SAP, and ensure that all activities are completed according to best practices and schedules. Identify critical issues and repetitive failures, perform Root Cause Analysis (RCA), implement recommendations, and manage work backlogs. Attend daily meetings and coordinate with Operations, TSD, Planning, HSE, and other departments to ensure effective maintenance and continuous improvement, including analyzing reliability reports and recommending changes to site-wide strategies. Implement and approve maintenance processes, ensuring the detection and mitigation of risks, and support the maintenance team in managing critical issues, bad actors, and work backlogs. Review and approve maintenance procedures, support maintenance contracts and shutdowns, and lead the implementation of advanced machinery learning techniques to predict equipment performance and enhance reliability. Key interactions Internal: Gas Network staff External: Staffing specialized Contractors, Vendors & Suppliers Working ConditionsField operations and office environment, moderate to intensive computer screen use.Education requirementsDiploma Degree or equivalent.LanguagePreferable English and ArabicExperience and backgroundFrom 3 to 5 years of experience in operations and maintenance preferably in the oil and gas sectors.Competencies and skillsPrinciples: Strategic Alignment: Ensure that every action and decision will support the organization's long-term goals and objectives. Transparency in Responsibility: Ability to create clear reporting systems to enhance operational efficiency and overall effectiveness. Continuous Improvement: Foster a culture of innovation and learning to adapt and grow in a changing environment. Sustainability: Ability to meet the current business needs by compromising skills with the future generations' needs, balancing environmental, social, and economic concerns within the organization's communities. Diversity and Inclusion: Foster diversity within the workforce and promote an inclusive culture by engaging with a broad array of perspectives and talents. Stakeholder Engagement: Actively involve and communicate with stakeholders to build trust and maintain strong relationships. Soft Skills: Knowledge of maintenance best practices. Acute Observation, Inspection, and problem-solving. Technical Reporting writing. Effective communication, investigations, and system troubleshooting. Technical Skills: Computerized Maintenance Management Systems (CMMS) Maintenance strategies Root Cause Analysis (RCA) Proficient at interpreting technical drawings (P&ID, PFD, SOP, DCS, TLAS) systems Process Safety management Ability to work with computer-based Business Applications (SAP) Operations processes, static and rotating equipment, and technical procedures Job Req ID: 56489Date: Jun 17, 2025Location:Muscat, OMEntity: OQ Gas Networks SAOCBusiness Unit: OQGNDivision: OperationsCountry/Region: OM OQ

title: Income Auditor
description: Company DescriptionA luxury hospitality brand for modern travelers, Anantara connects guests to genuine places, people and stories through personal experiences and providing heartfelt hospitality in the world's most exciting destinations. From pristine islands and tropical beaches to cosmopolitan cities, tranquil deserts and lush jungles, Anantara welcomes guests for journeys rich in discovery.Job DescriptionThe Income Auditor is responsible for auditing the daily revenue postings and adjustments processed. Balancing the daily revenue to the cash postings, tracking of the daily payroll report, and circulation of management reports. Work with department managers to ensure the hotel is in compliance with established standards. Balances hotel cash receipts and hotel credit cards. Balances daily charges and post necessary adjustments. Audit previous day postings for accuracy and ensure support ties to postings Prepares income breakdowns for each hotel outlet. Prepares and distribute daily management reports. Follow up on revenue audit issues in compliance with policies and procedures. Follow up the resolution of cashier over/shorts Assist Credit Manager with the resolution of credit card chargebacks. Maintain orderly daily audit packs for Hotel Receive, investigate, and respond to internal inquiries regarding daily reports Prepare and distribute daily routing pack of promotional checks and rebates Prepare monthly sales and use tax returns Audit telephone revenue vs. call accounting reports Audit banquet checks for accuracy Balance front desk and F&B paperwork Load monthly forecast and last year into income report Monitor Cash Machine, create/delete users, review daily reports and balance vs deposits and follow up on variances, order cash replenishment, prepare deposits to the bank. Qualifications Degree in Accounting/Business preferred. Must be knowledgeable of accounting principles. Previous AP experience, Hotel Night Audit or Front Office experience preferred. Must be knowledgeable in Microsoft Excel & Word; Excellent written, verbal and communication skills; professional demeanour required. Strong organizational skills with demonstrated numerical aptitude required. Strong Attention to Detail, and excellent time management skills. Able to solve problems in a timely and efficient manner. Must be able to work well under pressure. Additional InformationThe ideal candidate will be self motivated with a hands-on and flexible approach and be able to adapt to unpredictable events. You are pro-active and reliable and will thrive through working in a busy environment and stay calm under pressure, have attention to details and should possess following competencies: * Understanding the job Teamwork Taking Responsibility Recognising Differences Adaptability Customer Focus Minor International

title: Sr. Engineer Control & Automation
description: Job titleSr. Engineer Control and Automation (C&A)GradeStreamOQEPFunctionMusandam ClusterLocationOmanBudget control*OPEX and/or CAPEX and/or Revenue amount as relevant*Reporting toManager Operation & Maintenance SupportDirect reports-Job purposeExecute Control and Automation Works across Operated Assets sites and all related operations under Manager Operation & Maintenance Support scope as, as Technical Service provider of maintenance and execution of minor projects, modifications in accordance with the technical standards set by TSD to maintain the assets through performing routine maintenance troubleshooting and turning to the control system; in order to ensure plant equipment availability, reliability & optimization of cost / resources while facilitating smooth operations of the plant to meet operational targets.The position will act in accordance with the Group's Mission, Vision, Values & Strategies, as well as, policies, guidelines and international standards, supported by an IT Technology platform, HSE standards, Omani's government & other legal justifications, and best international practices in consonance with national objectives.Main tasks and responsibilities Receives assignment or work orders to executes all assigned works for C&A maintenance and calibration. Collect data from field and report them through proper communication channels. Receives assignment or work orders from supervisor and coordinates C/A activities with other peers for troubleshooting and repair works on distributed Control system and Logic controllers. Follow laid down procedures to undertake emergency shot down valves testing, and maintenance installations. Assist in troubleshooting and tuning on complex control loops Assist in programming of various Programmable Logic controllers. Maintains technical expertise in functional area. Carries out the technical evaluation of bids and generate the evaluation report. Coordinates efforts within the Section to develop guidelines, specifications, best practices and procedures for maintenance of pressure, level, flow, temperature, vibration and pH instruments. Maintains technical expertise in functional areas of process instrumentation and C&A. Execute Instrument and C&A maintenance services on planned / un-planned maintenance (CM, PM & TA) activities Execute, and execute projects initiated through MOC, RCA and another upgradation means as applicable. Providing Instrument and C&A technical and operational support to the upstream block 60 and Musandam Gas Plant all work for instruments calibration, control system, safeguarding system, Fire & Gas system and Fiscal Metering System and other related. Execute the assets registry, maintenance plans and bill of material for instrumentation and C&A Systems and equipment. Participated in RCM studies and provide technical support to improve reliability and availability. Determines long-term instrument policy and oversees detailed planning of maintenance activities and programs. Coordinates efforts within the Section to develop guidelines, specifications, best practices and procedures for instrument (pressure, level, flow, temperature, vibration and pH instruments). Support operations to ensure equipment/system performance is within defined Operating Envelope, and regularly conduct Alarms management review. Prepare tender strategy and SOW for initiated projects and carry out the technical evaluation of bids and generate the evaluation report. Provide support in terms of instrument troubleshooting, upset conditions and abnormal situations, and conduct RCA for the same. Responsible to upgrade obsolete systems like but not limited to DCS, ESD/IPS, FGS, RTU and PLC systems. Participate in technical reviews, Design, HAZOP, IPF/SIL, SAT, FAT and other meetings as warranted. Responsible for review/approval of all Instrumentation related Documents and drawings. Ensure availability of valid Maintenance service contracts to all critical equipment and systems. Prepare annual CAPEX and OPEX Budget estimation for instrumentation, control and Safeguarding system. title: Chef de Partie-Pastry
description: Prepare special meals or substitute items. Regulate temperature of ovens, broilers, grills, and roasters. Pull food from freezer storage to thaw in the refrigerator. Ensure proper portion, arrangement, and food garnish. Maintain food logs. Monitor the quality and quantity of food that is prepared. Communicate assistance needed during busy periods. Inform Chef of excess food items for use in daily specials. Inform Food & Beverage service staff of menu specials and out of stock menu items. Ensure the quality of the food items. Prepare and cook food according to recipes, quality standards, presentation standards, and food preparation checklist. Prepare cold foods.Assist management in hiring, training, scheduling, evaluating, counseling, disciplining, and motivating and coaching employees; serve as a role model. Follow all company and safety and security policies and procedures; report maintenance needs, accidents, injuries, and unsafe work conditions to manager; complete safety training and certifications. Ensure uniform and personal appearance are clean and professional; maintain confidentiality of proprietary information; protect company assets. Anticipate and address guests' service needs. Speak with others using clear and professional language. Develop and maintain positive working relationships with others; support team to reach common goals; listen and respond appropriately to the concerns of other employees. Ensure adherence to quality expectations and standards. Stand, sit, or walk for an extended period of time. Reach overhead and below the knees, including bending, twisting, pulling, and stooping. Move, lift, carry, push, pull, and place objects weighing less than or equal to 25 pounds without assistance. Perform other reasonable job duties as requested by Supervisors.PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONEducation: Technical, Trade, or Vocational School Degree.Related Work Experience: At least 3 years of related work experience.Supervisory Experience: No supervisory experience.License or Certification: NoneAt Marriott International, we are dedicated to being an equal opportunity employer, welcoming all and providing access to opportunity. We actively foster an environment where the unique backgrounds of our associates are valued and celebrated. Our greatest strength lies in the rich blend of culture, talent, and experiences of our associates. We are committed to non-discrimination on any protected basis, including disability, veteran status, or other basis protected by applicable law.W Hotels' mission is to Ignite Curiosity, Expand Worlds. We are a place to experience life. We're here to open doors and open minds. We are constantly inspired by new faces and new experiences. A tuned-in, up-for-anything spirit is at our core and has made us renowned for reinventing the norms of luxury around the globe. Whatever/Whenever is our culture and service philosophy that brings our guests' passions to life. If you are original, innovative, and always looking towards the future of what's possible, welcome to W Hotels. In joining W Hotels, you join a portfolio of brands with Marriott International. Be where you can do your best work,​ begin your purpose, belong to an amazing global​ team, and become the best version of you. W Hotels

title: Head, Maintenance Turnaround Services
description: Job titleHead of Maintenance Turnaround Services (T/A)GradeCompanyOQ8Function / DeptMaintenance - Turnaround ServicesLocationDuqmBudget control*OPEX and/or CAPEX and/or Revenue amount as relevant*Reporting toVP of MaintenanceDirect reportsJob purposeUnder the general direction of VP of Maintenance, Manages the preparation, execution and closure of turnarounds by (1) Manage and coordinate through sub-ordinate supervisors/planners the periodic turnaround activities for the entire OQ8's plants (refinery) in a safe, environmentally sound and cost-efficient manner. (2) Manage the repair process of equipment so that it runs safely until the next turnaround cycle by providing the best turnaround performance with respect to EH&S, (3) Assess the utilization, preparation, execution and closure costs through the proper application of Global Turnaround Methodology and the corresponding best practices; in order improve maintenance practices & asset availability for equipment, and (4) Ensure effective collaboration with other departments and functions in a matrix organization with the vertical line to deliver expected outcomes; in order to ensure that assets and equipment are available, minimize downtime, meet or exceed production targets and support the gross margin / profitability with sufficient organizational capability for business continuity.Main tasks and responsibilitiesScopeTurnaround is the periodic shutdown of a unit or the entire Plant for maintenance, inspection, repair, and improvement activities.The scope includes: Planning and scheduling Execution of maintenance activities Safety and environmental management Project management Quality control and assurance Commissioning and start-up Documentation and reporting Close out Accountabilities:Planning Develop detailed plans and schedules for turnaround activities, including work scope definition, resource requirements, materials and equipment procurement, and coordination with other refinery departments. Plan, control and oversees the execution of turnaround maintenance services to achieve the smooth operation of the plant and deliver effective (quality) and efficient (cost) services to Asset Owners to meet OMT objectives based on short business plans & long-term strategy, Ensures that effective planning & scheduling services are provided using best maintenance practices. Develop Turnaround organogram for execution of TA with detail roles and responsibility. Ensure timely & cost-efficient planning & scheduling of turnaround maintenance activities by optimising maintenance resources in order to reduce maintenance costs. Create contingency plans and working with the business to develop efficient inventories, appropriate budgets, and realistic timeframes / scopes. Utilize close-out reports, schedules & lessons learnt from previous turnaround to plan and schedule for next Turnarounds (TAs). Reviews and analyses reports, directives, and records and confers with other groups and departments to establish a cost-effective turnaround program. Develops new methods, solutions to problems, improved procedures, and practices to increase cost effectiveness, productivity, and mechanical reliability. Perform major job reviews for critical Turnaround (TA) related jobs by executing Job Safety Analysis and Job Hazard Assessment to ensure TA is accident free. Ensure long lead material will be on hand before 01 month of TA start date. Analyses contractor bids to recommend best and cost-effective contracts. Analyse the market trends and participate in formulating appropriate contracting strategies to ensure most effective and economic utilization of resources. Ensure compliance with all relevant regulatory requirements and standards, including safety and environmental regulations. Participate in the development and implementation of capital projects Turnaround execution Conduct all necessary maintenance activities during the turnaround, including equipment inspection, repair, replacement, and testing. This can also include activities such as vessel cleaning, catalyst replacement, pipe replacement or repair, and instrumentation calibration. Successful execution of the turnaround project in the shortest possible time and within approved budget. Monitoring Control of turnaround cost Control of turnround contractor manpower and equipment impact (mobilization and demobilization to avoid undue costs). Reviews the progress reports & performance indicators and takes appropriate action and coordinates with concerned teams to catch-up for lagging areas. Measure and record Turnaround contractors' performances and prepare periodical reports with recommendations on contractors' compliances to the contract's terms and conditions. Stakeholders Maintaining effective relationships with other departments within the refinery, including operations, engineering, and procurement Collaborate with other heads of maintenance to identify opportunities for process improvement and cost savings. Supervisory Manage Turnaround team by providing guidance and ensuring compliance with safety standards. Identify areas of improvement and motivate the staff. Ensure that all work performed by the team is documented and tracked, and that records are maintained in compliance with regulatory requirements. Education requirements Minimum Qualifications for this position are a degree in Mechanical / Electrical / Instrument Engineering or equivalent. Any further qualifications such as MBA or further engineering degree will be an advantage. Background and experienceCompetencies and skills 16+ years of relevant experience in Maintenance for the Oil & Gas or Petrochemical Industry with a minimum of 6 years of relevant experience in a similar role and leading position. Extensive experience in Maintenance & Project Works of Rotating, Static, Instrument & Electrical Equipment. Good knowledge of modern maintenance technologies & maintenance Planning techniques using CMMS systems (preferably SAP PM & MM Modules). Good knowledge in HSE / SCE equipment & plans. Knowledge in estimating, budgeting, and cost control. Knowledge in International Standards for Oil Gas & Petrochemical Plants. Good knowledge of plant operation, processes, and process flow. Good Knowledge of planning software (MS Project / Primavera) Soft: Leadership and people management skills Analytical thinking in data analysis. Communication skills. Critical thinking skills. Technical: Computer knowledge in MS Office applications like MS Word, MS excel etc. Good knowledge of SAP (PM & MM Modules) Systems (CMMS), MS project, Primavera Sound judgment in technical matters with good skills in engineering field. Safety and Health Management Maintenance Management and troubleshooting Technical Report writing Safety and environmental management Job Req ID: 56497Date: Jun 17, 2025Location:Duqm, OMEntity: Duqm Refinery & PetrochemBusiness Unit:Division:Country/Region: OM OQ

title: Middleware Specialist
description: Responsible for Application system integration including, Technical Analysis, API Development, Configuration and Environment support for Bank's Middleware application in liaison with various IT teams. Key responsibilities of this position are given below. Design, develop and maintain complex integration services and APIs based on industry standards and best practices using - IBM's App Connect Enterprise (previously IBM Integration Bus),- IBM Message Queue (MQ),- IBM DataPower and- IBM API Connect products. Provide technical support for bank's IT projects that involve integration between applications through the IBM middleware products (listed above). This includes, configuration fixes, code fixes, end-to-end testing support, user acceptance testing, performance and security testing support. Perform all required monitoring activities for the supported systems, including operation of utilities to support customer system and data implementations. - Responsible for maintenance and emergency response outside of normal business hours as necessary to maintain general application health and/or system upgrades.- Responsible for issue resolution & support in RCA analysis for Production incidents.- Follow proper escalation processes to meet or exceed target resolution timeframes.- Responsible for involving resources outside of IT when necessary to resolve- Must adhere to all standards & processes defined in the team for project delivery, peer review, security, incident & problem management. Must ensure that appropriate corrective and preventive actions are undertaken and resolve problems as soon as they arise. Must contribute ideas to help the support team to become more effective and seek ideas from other team members. Implement and manage security processes (both technical and procedural) to ensure uninterrupted operations and to comply with Bank and data privacy policies. Principal Accountabilities:-Responsible for design, development & supporting the Webservices/APIs used for integration of application systems-Liaison between the infrastructure and the applications groups, aiding one to understand the other and to ensure completion of development and/or maintenance activities of Bank's Middleware systemsRequirementsQualifications:1. Requires bachelor's degree in computer science/engineering.2. IBM Professional Certification on IBM App Connect Enterprise (or Integration Bus)3. IBM Professional Certification in below products is desireda. IBM DataPower Cunarionerb. IBM API Connectc. IBM MQ4. Relevant IT / Technology Professional certifications are desired.Experience: Minimum 8 years of experience in design, development & support of IT software solutions. Minimum 6 years of hands-on experience in design and development of integration solutions using products listed below - IBM App Connect Enterprise (mandatory)- IBM MQ (mandatory)- IBM DataPower (desired)- IBM API Connect (desired) Minimum 6 years of experience in API (RESTful) and Web Services (SOAP) design, development and testingTraining:Formal training in two or more of the IBM Middleware products listed below IBM App Connect Enterprise or Integration Bus Other skills and Abilities: Programming experience in Java & JEE systems. Working knowledge of java-based open-source technologies. Strong expertise in REST APIs & Web Services. Good knowledge of Unix/Linux systems, Banking applications & RDBMS databases Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively in both oral & written form. A clear and practical understanding and experience integrating technical services which support applications and users in the organization. Experience communicating by phone and face-to face with customers collecting requirements and implementation details, implementing solutions, and providing technical support. Interpersonal skills:Ability to establish confidence, rapport and foster cooperative relationships with business & coworkers. Comfortable initiating regular business contacts.Analytical Thinking:Good at acquiring an understanding of a problem or solution, and developing an approach to interacting with situationStrategic Perspective:Needs to keep overall objectives and strategies in mind and not be deflected by matters of detail.Applying standards:Good in application of relevant industry and process standards to all tasks undertaken SSC HR Solutions

title: Director of Spa & Wellness
description: Job Category: CreativeJob Description:About Us:A little curiosity fuels our soul for adventure and experiences. So, at Hotel Indigo ®, we do more than satisfy our guest's curiosity, we inspire them. Our passionate colleagues help create memorable and unique experiences for our guests; in a place truly connected to the local neighbourhood, infused with intriguing design and local flavours. Every day brings new discoveries, fresh ideas, and unexpected journeys.So, just like our hotels, no two colleagues are the same. So, we're curious about you. How will you inspire the eclectic rhythm in our hotels? How will you bring the local neighbourhood story to life? At Hotel Indigo® hotels, we're excited to meet spirited characters who can delight the most curious guests.Situated at 2,000m above sea level on the edge of the canyon in Jabal Akhdar, you will find a lifestyle property with 172 keys including penthouse suites and cliff side pool villas, the best spa in Oman spread over 2,200sq, plus great food and beverage concepts. We are a destination.Are you ready to join our pre-opening team to lay the foundations for us to disrupt and build a culture that changes the stay experience complimented by views that will leave everyone in awe!Your Day-to-DayAs the Director of Spa & Wellness, you will provide visionary leadership to the spa and recreation team, delivering a world-class guest experience while supporting sustainable business practices and nurturing a culture rooted in True Hospitality.People Lead, inspire, and develop a team of spa and recreation professionals to deliver exceptional service aligned with IHG® standards. Implement team engagement strategies including performance reviews, coaching, and continuous professional development. Partner with HR on staffing, recruitment, and any necessary employee relations actions. Financial Collaborate across departments to build relationships that enhance the overall guest experience while promoting responsible and profitable operations. Work with Sales and Marketing to design and promote wellness programs that drive revenue and elevate brand reputation. Contribute to the preparation of the annual budget, manage departmental expenses, and track key financial metrics to ensure goals are met. Guest Experience Foster a culture of excellence, ensuring spa and recreational offerings meet the evolving needs of guests. Oversee the quality, cleanliness, and safety of all spa and recreational areas, maintaining high brand standards. Resolve guest concerns and requests with empathy and efficiency to ensure satisfaction and loyalty. Responsible Business Champion environmentally sustainable and socially responsible initiatives, including waste reduction, energy efficiency, and community involvement. Ensure compliance with local regulations, industry standards, and all health and safety requirements. What We Need From You Bachelor's degree in Recreation Management, Hospitality, Business Administration, or a related field. Proven leadership experience in a spa, recreation, or hospitality management role. Strong financial acumen with experience managing budgets and analyzing financial reports. Exceptional team leadership, interpersonal, and organizational skills. Deep understanding of responsible business practices and community engagement. Excellent communication and problem-solving abilities. How You Will DeliverAt IHG®, we care deeply about people. That's why everything we do is grounded in our promise of True Hospitality, which you will deliver through: True Attitude - Being genuinely caring, making a positive impact, and forming real connections with guests and colleagues. True Confidence - Using your knowledge and skills to provide reliable, high-quality service that earns guest trust. True Listening - Focusing on verbal and non-verbal cues to understand guest needs and deliver tailored service. True Responsiveness - Anticipating and responding to guest needs promptly and thoughtfully. IHG Hotels & Resorts

title: OQGN, Principal Pipeline and Piping
description: Job titlePrincipal Pipeline & PipingPosition LevelLevel 4FunctionProject DeliveryDepartmentEngineeringLocationOmanBudget control*OPEX or CAPEX or Revenue amount as relevant*Reporting toManager EngineeringDirect reportsNAJob purposeLeading the execution of engineering pipeline and piping designs for pipeline systems and infrastructure, under the authority of the Manager of Engineering. Accountable for project standards and modifications associated with technical standards to preserve assets. Serve as a Subject Matter Expert with the skills to identify and troubleshoot issues related to the construction and installation of infrastructure, optimizing availability and reliability while sharing best practices. Develop performance improvement plans to ensure the appropriate engineering tools and maintenance are available and properly utilized to support the respective business functions guaranteeing business continuity and efficiency.The position will act according to the organization's mission, vision, values, policies, and guidelines, supported by an IT technology platform, HSE standards, the Oman government, and other legal justifications and best international practices aligned with national objectives.Mandate QHSSE Obligations Ensure compliance with the HSE Management System. Monitor and report safety performance and compliance. Guide, advise, communicate, and enforce safe behavioural practices (Life Saving Rules, Process Safety Rules) to perform tasks safely. Mandate Culture ObligationsHolding this role and contributing as a valuable member of our community, it is your responsibility to maintain OQGN's cultural principles, fostering growth and facilitating valuable contributions that will contribute to our organization's long-term success.Main tasks and responsibilities Lead technical design work on studies and project deliverables. Act in a consultative manner & technical reference to bring out the best strategies and approaches to deliver the technical requirements to pipeline design and engineering. Lead selection of indirect resources required in the field of Pipeline/Piping Engineers and allocate them efficiently in different projects. Responsible for the coordination and progress of Pipeline/Piping engineering design & support construction for all projects. Liaise with Vendor's representatives and other departments on all matters relating to Pipeline/Piping applications design & construction support for assigned projects. Responsible for technical accuracy, quality, and economy of Pipeline/Piping engineering applications design for projects. Ensure that Company Safety and Quality Control Procedures are followed during the execution of all contracts and that a high standard of safety is achieved in all design work. Support project execution inclusive of pre-commissioning, commissioning and handover Supervise the preparation of the necessary documentation for assigned projects, establishing major methods and data as necessary, and ensuring the selection of the optimum Pipeline/Piping design from both technical and economic standpoints. Ensure that design methods, standards and data used conform to Asset Owners requirements and/or those issued by the Engineering department. Lead and develop the scope of Pipeline/Piping engineering/construction applications work and project execution strategy for proposals. Participate in discussions at the concept stage with Asset Owners to assist in the definition of the scope of work and project execution strategy. Participate in pre- and post-contract awards in discussions/reviews with Asset Owners to assess and assist in the definition of user requirements. Lead the review of Pipeline/Piping Engineering Deliverables and participate in project reviews and workshops. Lead solving Pipeline/Piping engineering challenges that are recognised during the development of the Front-End Engineering Design Package, detailed engineering and construction phase. Identify gaps in existing practices and tools and manage the process of developing new practices/guidelines or toolkit items that enhance technological offerings. Develop graduate engineers through the preparation and delivery of training courses/coaching. Ensure lessons learnt are carried out through the project execution phases about pipelines and ensure application on all projects, this is in coordination with the assigned Pipeline/Piping leads & Engineers and the project team. Lead implementation of innovative solutions in the pipeline function Support the development of the departmental budget and evaluation of total project costs Key interactions Internal: Liaise with colleagues within Projects, functional leaders, and other internal stakeholders. External: Contractors, vendors, national government offices, external consultants Working ConditionsPrimarily office-based, occasional travel, and sporadic visits to the operation site.Education requirementsBachelor's degree or equivalent in Mechanical Engineering, or equivalent.LanguagePreferable English and ArabicExperience and background From 12 to 14 years of experience in engineering disciplines e.g. pipeline & pipping, and mechanical in the oil and gas sectors. Understanding of pipeline and piping design standards, refineries, petrochemical plants, storage tanks, and standard codes (API, ASME, ASTM, PIP). Familiar with resource control, contract management, and general project management Competencies and skillsPrinciples: Strategic Alignment: Ensure that every action and decision will support the organization's long-term goals and objectives. Transparency in Responsibility: Ability to create clear reporting systems to enhance operational efficiency and overall effectiveness. Continuous Improvement: Foster a culture of innovation and learning to adapt and grow in a changing environment. Sustainability: Ability to meet the current business needs by compromising skills with the future generations' needs, balancing environmental, social, and economic concerns within the organization's communities. Diversity and Inclusion: Foster diversity within the workforce and promote an inclusive culture by engaging with various perspectives and talents. Stakeholder Engagement: Actively involve and communicate with stakeholders to build trust and maintain strong relationships. Soft Skills: Strong interpersonal, analytical, communication, presentation, coaching, and project management. Change agent with strong credibility to influence the organization and effective partnerships. Ability to manage and direct the activities of others in a multi-project environment. Strong commitment to Ethical principles and values. Ability to apply causal analysis or other root cause failure analysis methodologies to identify the root cause of Technical Quality failures. Technical Skills: Computer literate with expertise in MS Office and SAP Systems. Technical engineering terminology in English and Arabic languages. HSE, finance, budget, and reporting. Detailed understanding of general industry standards and the requirements of the more frequently referenced standards. HSE Management System, ISO Certifications and standards, SOP interpretation, and risk management methods and practices. title: OQGN, Specialist Occupational Health
description: Specialist Occupational HealthPosition LevelLevel 7QHSSEDepartmentHSE - HSE SupportOmanBudget control*OPEX or CAPEX or Revenue amount as relevant*Manager HSE SupportDirect reportsN/AJob purposeA Specialist of Occupational Health plays a critical role in ensuring workforce well-being, regulatory compliance, and proactive health risk management to support the OQGN Occupational Health Framework and ensure compliance with OPAL requirements. The holder of this role ensures adherence to OPAL HSE guidelines, Oman labor laws, and international standards (OSHA, WHO, ILO) by implementing medical surveillance, workplace hygiene monitoring, and health risk assessments. Managing fitness-to-work evaluations, occupational disease prevention, and health promotion programs to reduce absenteeism and improve workforce well-being. Supporting the investigation of occupational health-related incidents, recommending preventive measures, enhancing medical emergency preparedness and addressing growing operational demands by integrating occupational health best practices, ensuring business continuity, and supporting sustainability goals.The position will act according to the organization's mission, vision, values, policies, and guidelines, supported by an IT technology platform, HSE standards, the Oman government, and other legal justifications and best international practices aligned with national objectives.Mandate QHSSE Obligations Ensure compliance with the HSE Management System. Monitor and report safety performance and compliance. Guide, advise, communicate, and enforce safe behavioural practices (Life Saving Rules, Process Safety Rules) to perform tasks safely. Mandate Culture ObligationsHolding this role and contributing as a valuable member of our community, it is your responsibility to maintain OQGN's cultural principles, foster growth, and facilitate valuable contributions that will contribute to our organization's long-term success.Main tasks and responsibilities Establish and promote the maintenance of safe and healthy working conditions in a business by formulating robust occupational health policies and measures. Conduct health risk assessments (HRAs) to identify and mitigate workplace health hazards (e.g., noise, heat stress, chemical exposure). Monitor workplace hygiene conditions and recommend corrective actions to prevent occupational illnesses. Support fitness-to-work evaluations, ensuring employees are medically fit for their designated roles. Implement and monitor medical surveillance programs (e.g., audiometry, respiratory health checks, biological monitoring). Coordinate pre-employment, periodic, and exit medical examinations as per regulatory and company standards. Work with occupational health physicians to analyze trends in occupational illnesses and recommend preventive strategies. Ensure compliance with Oman labor laws, OPAL HSE regulations, and international standards (e.g., OSHA, ILO, WHO). Maintain records and reports in line with legal and corporate requirements for occupational health. Participate in audits and inspections related to occupational health. Organize first aid and emergency response training for employees. Develop and implement health awareness programs (e.g., fatigue management, mental health, nutrition, and lifestyle diseases). Support ergonomic assessments and recommend improvements for workplace safety and comfort. Assist in investigating occupational health-related incidents and illnesses to determine root causes and preventive measures. Prepare reports and recommendations for management based on findings. Collaborate with HSE, PT&C, medical service providers, and regulatory authorities to ensure seamless occupational health implementation. Support emergency response teams in medical emergencies and occupational health crises. Ensure the timely collation of Occupational Health statistics and reporting every month. Monitor and track the Occupational Health Module in Intelex for requests for periodic medical checks and evaluations Coordinate with the OQGN-approved medical provider or OQ clinic for any interface activities related to Occupational Health in OQGN. Ensure accurate and confidential OH records in compliance with legal and ethical requirements. Act as the ergonomics SME and conduct ergonomic assessments across office and field settings. Lead health awareness campaigns covering nutrition, chronic illness, mental health, ergonomics, and lifestyle. Take part in emergency drills and provide on-site medical support during emergencies. Audit contractor OH arrangements and align them with OQGN standards. Promote mental health and psychosocial well-being as part of workplace culture. Representing OQGN in health forums and national OH networks to stay informed and influence industry practices. Key interactions Internal: Gas Network staff External: Investors, Industry Peers, Regulators. Working ConditionsPrimarily office-based, occasional travel, and sporadic visits to the operational site.Education requirementsBachelor's degree, Diploma degree, or equivalent in Nursing and Occupational HealthLanguagePreferable English and ArabicExperience and backgroundFrom 4 to 5 years of experience in Occupational Health Management, including associated policies, standards, procedures, and guidelines, risk management techniques, audit management and incident investigation and analysis, preferably in the oil and gas sectors.Competencies and skillsPrinciples: Strategic Alignment: Ensure that every action and decision will support the organization's long-term goals and objectives. Transparency in Responsibility: Ability to create clear reporting systems to enhance operational efficiency and overall effectiveness. Continuous Improvement: Foster a culture of innovation and learning to adapt and grow in a changing environment. Sustainability: Ability to meet the current business needs by compromising skills with the future generations' needs, balancing environmental, social, and economic concerns within the organization's communities. Diversity and Inclusion: Foster diversity within the workforce and promote an inclusive culture by engaging with various perspectives and talents. Stakeholder Engagement: Actively involve and communicate with stakeholders to build trust and maintain strong relationships. Soft Skills: Strong interpersonal, analytical, communication, presentation, coaching, and project management. Change agent with strong credibility to influence the organization and effective partnerships. Ability to manage and direct the activities of others in a multi-project environment. Strong commitment to Ethical principles and values. Ability to apply causal analysis or other root cause failure analysis methodologies to identify the root cause of Technical Quality failures. Technical Skills: Computer literate with expertise in MS Office and SAP Systems. Technical engineering terminology in English and Arabic. HSE, finance, budget, and reporting. Occupational Health Risk Assessments Omani and International Health and Safety Standards, regulations and HSE audits. Fundamentals of HSSE - Comprehensive knowledge of occupational health and safety. Detailed understanding of general industry standards and the requirements of the more frequently referenced standards HSSE Management System, ISO Certifications and standards, and risk management methods and practices.
