description: Job Category: Hotel-Food and BeverageJob Description:Your day-to-day key responsibilitiesF&B Service Operations: Oversee daily F&B service operations across all outlets (restaurant, bar, room service, banquets, etc.) Ensure exceptional guest service standards and memorable experiences. title: HSSE Officer | Al-Futtaim Automotive | OMASCO
description: Job Requisition ID: 170181Established in the 1930s as a trading business, Al-Futtaim Group today is one of the most diversified and progressive, privately held regional businesses headquartered in Dubai, United Arab Emirates. Structured into five operating divisions; automotive, financial services, real estate, retail and healthcare; employing more than 35,000 employees across more than 20 countries in the Middle East, Asia and Africa, Al-Futtaim Group partners with over 200 of the world's most admired and innovative brands. Al-Futtaim Group's entrepreneurship and relentless customer focus enables the organization to continue to grow and expand; responding to the changing needs of our customers within the societies in which we operate.By upholding our values of respect, excellence, collaboration and integrity; Al-Futtaim Group continues to enrich the lives and aspirations of our customers each and every dayOverview of the role We are looking for a dedicated HSSE Officer to join our team at OMASCO in Oman. The HSSE Officer will be responsible for managing the implementation, monitoring, and continual improvement of Health, Safety, Security, and Environmental (HSSE) standards across all OMASCO operations in Oman. This role requires self-leadership and initiative while receiving strategic direction and technical guidance from the Central Automotive Government Affairs & HSSE Department based in the UAEWhat you will do Ensure compliance with local regulatory requirements and alignment with the Automotive Division's HSSE policies, standards, and procedures Cultivate a proactive HSSE culture, drive awareness, mitigate operational risks, and support the business in achieving its compliance and safety performance objectives Enhance business unit compliance status with regards to HSSE related government regulations, policies, and standards Maintain firefighting and alarm systems, security systems, environmental clearance certificates, and hazardous waste storage and disposal permits Monitor emissions and ensure they are within permissible ranges Conduct health screenings and organize emergency drills Manage incidents and emergencies effectively to minimize harm to assets, operations, reputation, and business Facilitate training, certification, and regular briefing of site security Ensure all facilities are maintained in good condition and compliant with HSSE standard Required skills to be successful A Bachelor's degree in occupational health & safety, Environmental Sustainability, or relevant scientific fields such as Mechanical, Electrical, or Chemical Engineering NEBOSH IGC & IOSH certifications 2-3 years of experience as a field HSSE officer, preferably in Automotive scope of operation or similar operations Strong analytical and critical thinking skill About the team You will be part of the MD Office at OMASCO, working closely with the Central Automotive Government Affairs & HSSE Department based in the UAE. The team is committed to maintaining a safe, compliant, and environmentally responsible work environment in line with both local laws and the Group's HSSE expectations.What equips you for the role Demonstrate sound judgment, accountability, and initiative Have experience in conducting inspections, incident investigations, compliance reporting, employee training, emergency preparedness, and risk assessments Are proactive, solutions-driven, and committed to maintaining a safe work environment Are available on-call 24x7 to respond promptly to emergencies and safety-related concerns Attention to detail and ability to prioritize tasks Team management and conflict management skills Good reporting and documentation skills Fluency in English and Arabi About Al-Futtaim Automotive A major division of the UAE-based Al-Futtaim Group of companies, Al-Futtaim Automotive is an industry leader with presence in 10 countries across the Middle East, Asia and Africa. Our core business activities at Al-Futtaim Automotive include distribution, manufacturing, leasing and aftersales, and we are firmly established as the regional representative of some of the world's most iconic automotive brands: Toyota, Lexus, Honda, Jeep, Chrysler, Dodge, Volvo and RAM. We are driven by a customer-centric approach, constantly pushing the boundaries on innovation, quality standards, and value-added service across our vast universe of customers - right from motoring enthusiasts to fleet operators to contractors. Our mission is to become the leader in custom-made mobility solutions by delivering nothing less than world-class omni-channel experiences. We channel our local expertise and global trust to deliver one of the most comprehensive portfolios of mobility products and solutions, from passenger cars to SUVs, electric vehicles to high-performance motorbikes, commercial vehicles to industrial & construction equipment. What keeps the company moving forward is a 9000-member strong team, with inspiring possibilities for growth, throughout the career path. This is Al-Futtaim Automotive and we empower talent to move forward. Al-Futtaim

title: Senior Engineer Electrical Power (Block 60&48)
description: Job titleSenior Engineer Electrical Power Block-60GradeStreamUpstreamFunctionOperated Assets - Operations - Maintenance Support - Maintenance ExcellencyLocationField Location, OmanBudget control*OPEX and/or CAPEX and/or Revenue amount as relevant*Reporting toTeam Lead E&I - MaintenanceDirect reports0Job purposeManage, support, and supervise OQEP owned facilities and plants for all electrical parts of equipment including maintenance, condition monitoring and operation of electrical parts of equipment (including power generators, substations, electrical power distribution system etc.) on a regular basis to ensure long term availability of electrical power system, equipment and to minimize the risk of unplanned shutdowns. Accountable for continuous flow of electrical power to plants, substations, and buildings.Serve as the focal point for managing and maintaining the electrical power distribution network across the site, including 132 kV and 33 kV Overhead Lines (OHL), electrical substations, and related infrastructure. Ensure system reliability, effective maintenance execution, and compliance with safety & quality standards while overseeing contractors and supporting technical field teams. Implement and optimize preventive and corrective maintenance programs.Main tasks and responsibilities Act as the focal point for all maintenance activities related to Overhead Lines (132 kV and 33 kV), electrical substations, switchgears, and the site-wide electrical grid. Develop and Manage maintenance service contracts for the entire electrical grid and associated distribution systems. Develop, implement, and oversee preventive and corrective maintenance plans to ensure the safety, efficiency, and reliability of the electrical infrastructure. Development, implement, and management of electrical SOPs (standard operating procedures) for operation & maintenance of entire electrical power system. Management of annual budgets for OPEX, CAPEX, Shutdowns, and Inventory enhancement. Provide input on electrical parts of equipment while ensuring adherence to quality standards, timelines and equipment specifications with an objective to improve equipment's long-term reliability. Identify the critical issues, repetitive failure of electrical equipment. Lead/participate RCA (Root Cause Analysis) to avoid recurrence of failures/incidents and implement the recommendations. Manage electrical system modifications to existing plant equipment and provide recommendations on the electrical aspects of the equipment. Prepare and submit the Management of Change (MOC) proposal for electrical system. Ensure that all electrical related modifications/changes/ additions are performed in compliance with existing design standards for plant and owned facilities. Coordinate efforts within the section to develop guidelines, specifications, best practices, and procedures for maintenance. Maintain technical expertise in functional areas. Conduct routine inspections, performance assessments, and diagnostic tests on all electrical components and systems. Coordinate with cross-functional teams, including field operators, HSE teams, and contractors, to ensure seamless communication and operational effectiveness. Participate in design reviews related to projects, process control functions, Shutdown functions and Safety functions (e.g. P&ID, SAFE Chart, Cause & Effect Charts etc.), SAFOP, HAZOP/HAZID, Value engineering workshops etc.as required. Troubleshoot and resolve electrical issues in a timely manner to minimize downtime and maintain grid stability. Monitor and analyze system performance data to recommend and implement improvements that enhance grid performance and resilience. Liaison with stakeholders, vendors, OEMs, consultants to manage all the activities and electrical infrastructure. Oversee contractors and third-party vendors in the execution of maintenance activities, ensuring compliance with relevant standards and safety procedures and systems. Ensure that all maintenance activities are documented and comply with regulatory requirements and industry standards. Provide technical support and guidance to on-site teams, helping them adhere to industry best practices in electrical grid maintenance. Keep abreast of technological advancements and regulatory changes in the field of electrical power engineering. Ensure compliance with electrical safety rules including lock out and tag out energy isolation procedures and standards. Knowledge and understanding of various protection schemes and testing methods. Manage and oversee HV/LV electrical isolations related to the grid and associated systems. * Review, approve and manage e-PTW/PTWs for Electrical work or works performed within the vicinity of OHL or substations. Familiarity of protection relay and CT&PT testing, functional checks and its requirements Responsible for electrical safety systems and act as area authority for HV and LV systems. Ensure OQEP Safety and Quality control procedures are followed during the execution of all work and that a high standard of safety is achieved in all works. Preparation, review & approval of HV system Grid switching Programs and ability to carry Grid power switching Knowledge and Familiarity of Power transformer testing and requirements Experience of primary and secondary OMICRON testing equipment (like CMC 356, CPC100, Testron etc.…) Knowledge and working experience of substation automation systems, IEC 61850 and GOOSE communications. Key interactionsInternal: Operated AssetsExternal: Contractors, Vendors & SuppliersNotable Working Conditions. Field Operations and office environment, moderate to intensive computer screen use.Education requirements Bachelor's in Electrical Engineering, or related domain. Language requirementsExcellent knowledge of written, read, and spoken English (required) | Arabic - Native (desirable)Background and experienceCompetencies and skillsBachelorGrade 610+ years of relevant experience 10 years of experience in electrical maintenance engineering, with emphasis on high-voltage systems (132/33kV), substations, and protection systems. Experience in the oil & gas or utility industry preferred. At least 5 years in HV systems ≥132kV is preferable Senior Authorized / Certified Electrical Person for high voltage (SAEP) Ability to perform Risk Assessments for electrical HV works. Competent in switching and isolation procedures in accordance with electrical safety standards and regulations. Knowledge and experience in design, operation, maintenance of major electrical equipment e.g. Gas/Air insulated switchgear, power transformer, LV/HV motors, HV/LV cables including testing and commissioning requirements. various specialized testing equipment e.g. primary and secondary OMICRON testing equipment (like CMC 356, CPC100, Testron etc.), Power analyzer, Generator/Motor analyzers- All test Pro/PdMA tester, Dilectric tester etc. Knowledge and working experience of substation automation systems, IEC 61850 and GOOSE communications. Soft: Excellent interpersonal skills and multi-cultural sensitivity. Adaptable and motivated general management strategist who relishes challenges. Excellent verbal and written communication skills High attention to detail, particularly when working with maintenance records, system data, and generating reports. Ability to handle complex material management tasks, ensuring stock levels align with maintenance needs and preventing shortages or overstock situations Ability to identify issues and implementing effective solutions Ability to prioritize tasks and manage time effectively in a diversified and critical environment Ability to understand and coordinate with cross discipline team Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines Fundamentals of Electrical safety and safe system of work. Technical: Strong knowledge of HV/MV systems, transformers, switchgear, and protection relays. Familiarity with SCADA, substation automation, and IEC 61850 protocols. Ability to read and interpret electrical schematics and perform field diagnostics. Strong understanding of electrical safety regulations and IEC/IEEE, NFPA 70E, and OSHA standards. Experience using CMMS (e.g., SAP PM) for planning and tracking maintenance activities. Excellent communication and leadership skills to manage field teams and vendors. Problem-solving and analytical skills with attention to detail. Capability to manage contractors and third-party service providers. Job Req ID: 56485Date: Jun 15, 2025Location:Tubul, OMEntity: OQ Exploration and Prod.Business Unit:Division:Country/Region: OM OQ

title: Housekeeping Supervisor
description: The Housekeeping Supervisor plays a crucial role in maintaining cleanliness and order in facilities within the utilities sector in Qatar. This position is essential for ensuring that all housekeeping operations run smoothly and efficiently, contributing to a safe and pleasant environment for both staff and visitors. The ideal candidate will possess strong leadership skills, a keen eye for detail, and a commitment to high standards of cleanliness and hygiene.Responsibilities: * Supervise and coordinate daily housekeeping activities to ensure cleanliness and maintenance of all areas. Train and mentor housekeeping staff on best practices, safety protocols, and operational procedures. Conduct regular inspections of facilities to ensure compliance with cleanliness standards and address any issues promptly. Manage inventory of cleaning supplies and equipment, ensuring adequate stock levels and proper usage. Develop and implement housekeeping schedules to optimize staff efficiency and coverage. Collaborate with other departments to address specific cleaning needs and ensure seamless operations. Maintain records of housekeeping activities, including staff performance and incident reports. Assist in the recruitment and onboarding of new housekeeping staff as needed. Handle guest complaints and feedback related to housekeeping services effectively. Ensure compliance with health and safety regulations in all housekeeping operations. Preferred Candidate: * Strong leadership and team management skills. Excellent attention to detail and organizational abilities. Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple tasks. Effective communication skills, both verbal and written. Proficient in using cleaning equipment and chemicals safely. Experience in a supervisory role within the housekeeping or facilities management sector. Knowledge of health and safety regulations related to housekeeping. Ability to train and develop team members effectively. Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to handle complaints professionally. Flexibility to work various shifts, including weekends and holidays. Bayt

title: Chief Technology Officer (CTO)- Industrial manufacturing
description: Job Description :This is a full-time on-site role as a Chief Technology Officer (CTO) located in Muscat. The CTO will be responsible for defining and implementing the company’s technology and industrial strategy, leading the technical setup of the factory, and ensuring the integration of engineering processes across mechanical, electrical, hydraulic, and composite manufacturing. The role includes overseeing technology transfer from OEM partners, ensuring compliance with international standards (IEC, ISO), and managing the technical roadmap from initial production ramp-up to mass manufacturing. Daily responsibilities include cross-functional coordination with engineering, quality assurance, and operations teams, as well as direct engagement in factory layout, equipment commissioning, and certification processes.Requirements Proven experience in industrial manufacturing or engineering leadership, ideally in wind energy, aerospace, or heavy equipment sectors Deep understanding of nacelle, hub, blade, or tower production processes, including composite manufacturing and mechanical assembly Expertise in factory setup, process design, and industrial technology implementation Familiarity with IEC 61400 standards and quality systems (ISO 9001, ISO 45001) Strong leadership and communication skills, capable of managing multidisciplinary engineering teams Proficiency in technology licensing, product industrialization, and scaling of production Degree in Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Industrial Engineering, or a related technical field; a Master’s degree or MBA is an advantage Experience working with international OEMs and knowledge of technology transfer protocols is a plus Fluency in English; knowledge of Arabic or Chinese is an asset Green Umbrella Recruitment

title: Director of Housekeeping

aid of the Assistant Director of Housekeeping, the supervision of all Housekeeping Supervisors, Housekeeping Attendants, Linen Attendants, Tailor, Cleaners and Order Takers and hence balance Employee working schedules to meet peak and slack period while remaining within Union and Labour Law requirements Hire and develop Employees whilst maintaining a close payroll control Maintain a close liaison Engineering Department to ensure smooth flow of repair work and adequate completion of daily maintenance tasks and preventive maintenance jobs to adhere to the local Government requirements Maintain an effective working relationship with the Laundry Department to ensure a smooth flow of Rooms linen, uniforms and Food & Beverage linen that has been processed to the required standards of the Hotel Organise and manage linen inventories for Guest rooms and assist with Food & Beverage linen inventories to ensure adequate inventory levels are maintained Maintain and manage the overall functions of the Linen Room and repair services to the established standards Maintain the inventory of Guestroom and cleaning supplies, ordering replacements when necessary, whilst keeping a strict control on expenses to ensure that they are within budgets that have been set Rotana

title: Assistant Lecturer - Economics and Finance ibsm
description: About GUtech:The German University of Technology in Oman (GUtech) was established in Muscat, the capital of the Sultanate of Oman in 2007 in collaboration with RWTH Aachen University. GUtech aims to become a leading university of technology in the wider region by building on the three pillars of education, research, and innovation. Through its affiliation with RWTH Aachen University, GUtech provides students with a high-quality education and socially responsible graduates, guided by German excellence and with a firm grounding in Oman's culture and heritage. GUtech's programs of study are accredited by the German agency ACQUIN, and the University has recently undergone a successful evaluation by the German Academic Exchange Service DAAD. GUtech faculty members also engage in research projects, locally, in cooperation with RWTH Aachen University, and other universities abroad.About the Faculty:The Faculty of Business and Economics offers undergraduate programs in “Logistics” and “International Business and Service Management”, and postgraduate programs in a “Master of Business Administration (MBA)” and a Master of Science in Hydrogen Economy and Technology. We are seeking a collaborative and enthusiastic individual to join our growing department.Job Description:We seek a qualified Assistant Lecturer in Economics and Finance to join our dynamic department and contribute to our teaching and research mission. You’ll play a key role in delivering high-quality instruction by leading Economics and Finance tutorial sessions. You’ll also actively support main instructors by collaborating on course design, updating topics and materials, and developing assessments. Relevant courses include Financial and Managerial Accounting, Microeconomics, Macroeconomics, Finance and Investment, and others.Tasks & Responsibilities: Deliver well-prepared-lectures, tutorials and other forms of interactions with students. Support the development of teaching materials and course curriculum. Support courses coordination. Provide academic advisory and support to undergraduate students. Collaborate with colleagues and participate in departmental activities. Demonstrate a commitment to continuous professional development. Stay up-to-date with the latest developments in Economics and Finance. Maintain high standards of professionalism and ethics. Assist with administrative tasks within the department as needed. Contribute towards the achievement of strategic goals of the University, with a focus on excellence in Learning & Teaching and interaction with stakeholders. Promote the values of the University, especially multicultural awareness and ethical practices. Strengthening the nexus between teaching, research, and industry. Contribute to the department’s research activities (optional, if applicable). Requirements and CompetenciesCandidates for this position must demonstrate their compliance with the following requirements: Bachelor's degree in economics, finance or a related field (Master's degree preferred, but not mandatory). Minimum two years of experience following graduation. Demonstrated experience in effective teaching at the university level (preferrable). Demonstrated industry experience in the relevant discipline (preferrable). Strong communication, interpersonal, and organizational skills. Ability to work collaboratively in a team-oriented multicultural environment. A passion for Economics and Finance and a commitment to student success. Experience developing and implementing student-centered learning approaches. A good research record in a relevant field (optional, if applicable). Required Documents Curriculum Vitae Cover Letter highlighting your teaching philosophy and interest in GUtech Teaching Statement outlining your teaching experience and approach Two Letters of Reference Benefits Two years contract, renewable based on positive performance reviews Competitive salary and benefits package Opportunity to work in a dynamic and international environment Access to GUtech’s extensive research network GUtech

title: Engineering Manager - Jumeirah Muscat Bay
description: About Jumeirah:Jumeirah, a global leader in luxury hospitality and a member of Dubai Holding, operates an exceptional portfolio of 31 properties, including 33 signature F&B restaurants, across the Middle East, Europe, Asia and Africa. In 1999, Jumeirah changed the face of luxury hospitality with the opening of the iconic Jumeirah Burj Al Arab and the brand is now renowned worldwide for its distinguished beachfront resorts, esteemed city hotels and luxury residences. From the contemporary Maldivian island paradise at Jumeirah Olhahali Island to the art-inspired Jumeirah Capri Palace in Italy and the modern twist on a British classic at Jumeirah Carlton Tower in London, the brand has become synonymous with warm and generous service and the ability to craft distinctive and purposeful experiences that bring joy to guests from across the world.Set in the secluded cove of Bandar Jissah, nestled between the Al Hajar Mountains and the Gulf of Oman, Jumeirah Muscat Bay invites guests to discover Muscat’s breathtaking nature, with mountains meeting the sea at the resort’s doorstep. The resort features 195 rooms and suites with spectacular ocean views, including ten opulent summerhouses and villas featuring private plunge pools and private beach access.Opened in 2022, the resort offers a diverse array of amenities, including a sprawling 1,200 square meter Talise Spa, a Pedi:Mani:Cure Studio by Bastien Gonzalez, a PADI and SSI certified dive centre, numerous leisure facilities and adventurous wellbeing experiences, plus several signature dining options and a kids club, providing ample opportunity to relax and rechargeAbout the Job:An opportunity has arisen for Engineering - Manager to join our Team in Jumeirah Muscat Bay. The main duties and responsibilities of this role: To lead and oversee engineering teams in the design, development, and implementation of innovative solutions, ensuring alignment with Jumeirah’s objectives, adherence to quality standards, and timely delivery of projects. Providing strategic direction, fostering collaboration, and optimizing resources to drive technical excellence, enhance productivity, and achieve business success in dynamic and evolving engineering environments. Handle the programming and administration of the BMS systems according to the needs and requirements to support the accurate operation of the facilities and the management of the desired temperature, lighting, and operation of facilities. Plan and coordinate the reprogramming / upgrading of the BMS systems through installing new hardware and software’s to improve operational efficiency and enable energy savings. Participate in the scheduling and effective execution of the preventative maintenance of the HVAC / Electrical / Mechanical / Plumbing infrastructure by managing accordingly the BMS system and coordinating with all relevant parties for the effective execution of the maintenance activities. Ensure proper maintenance of the BMS systems to maintain their functionality and compliance with operating standards. Monitor and record the values and data reported in the BMS system identifying areas for improvement and suggesting alterations in the programming of the system that will improve the qualitative and cost-efficient operation of the facilities. Ensure compliance with all relevant Health, Safety and Environment management procedures and controls within a defined area of activity so that Jumeirah Group provides world class and luxurious hospitality services to its guests. Implement approved departmental policies, processes, and procedures, and provide instructions to subordinates and monitor their adherence so that work is carried out in a controlled and consistent manner while delivering a quality service to guests and maintaining standards of excellence. QualificationsAbout YouBachelor’s degree in engineering or any other relevant field.TECHNICAL COMPETENCIES Software competencies – Microsoft Office programs (Advanced) BEHAVIORAL COMPETENCIES Problem solving Leadership and team management skills Creative Project Management Skills Detail orientated About the Benefits:We offer an attractive tax-free salary, paid in Omani Rials (OMR), the local currency of Oman. In addition, we provide generous Food & Beverage discounts, reduced hotel rates across our global properties, an excellent leave and healthcare package, life insurance, performance-based incentives, and a range of other employee benefits. This makes the role highly appealing to top performers and to anyone seeking a rewarding career with one of the most luxurious brands in the hospitality industry. Jumeirah

title: Field Operator I

Perform routine operational tasks under supervision, ensuring safety and procedural standards compliance. Communicate effectively with team members and supervisors to maintain reliable and trouble-free operations..Principle Duties & Responsibilities Assist in operating and monitoring process equipment ensuring compliance with safety standards Monitor and record equipment operational parameters in the field, reporting abnormalities to the Control Room Operator (CRO) or Supervisors Support system start-ups and shutdowns as directed by supervisor Assist in pressurizing and depressurizing equipment and pipelines when required Regularly check pressure, delta pressure, temperature, and level gauges, reporting irregularities to the CRO Follow instructions from the CRO or Supervisors to maintain stable plant operations and support production optimization Adhere to QHSE standards and procedures (e.g., LOTO, PTW, TBT, JHA) and ensure proper documentation of tasks Participate in training and reviews of operational procedures, offering basic feedback for improvement Conduct basic operational and maintenance checks (daily, weekly, monthly) under supervision Assist in preparing equipment for maintenance, including isolation, draining, and decontamination Ensure accurate and timely handover of information to the next shift team Identify and report unsafe conditions to supervisors. Safely handle and top up chemicals, lubricants, and coolants, collecting samples as directed Maintain housekeeping and cleanliness standards during and after tasks Comply with Emergency Response Team (ERT) roles and responsibilities as assigned Comply with all Enerflex HR, Quality, HSE, and all the Company policies, procedures, processes, work instructions and guidelines Perform all other duties as assigned by Supervisor / Manager Responsible for assisting in the safe and efficient operation of the plant to support production targets. Perform routine operational tasks under supervision, ensuring safety and procedural standards compliance. Communicate effectively with team members and supervisors to maintain reliable and trouble-free operations..Principle Duties & Responsibilities Assist in operating and monitoring process equipment ensuring compliance with safety standards Monitor and record equipment operational parameters in the field, reporting abnormalities to the Control Room Operator (CRO) or Supervisors Support system start-ups and shutdowns as directed by supervisor Assist in pressurizing and depressurizing equipment and pipelines when required Regularly check pressure, delta pressure, temperature, and level gauges, reporting irregularities to the CRO Follow instructions from the CRO or Supervisors to maintain stable plant operations and support production optimization Adhere to QHSE standards and procedures (e.g., LOTO, PTW, TBT, JHA) and ensure proper documentation of tasks Participate in training and reviews of operational procedures, offering basic feedback for improvement Conduct basic operational and maintenance checks (daily, weekly, monthly) under supervision Assist in preparing equipment for maintenance, including isolation, draining, and decontamination Ensure accurate and timely handover of information to the next shift team Identify and report unsafe conditions to supervisors. Safely handle and top up chemicals, lubricants, and coolants, collecting samples as directed Maintain housekeeping and cleanliness standards during and after tasks Comply with Emergency Response Team (ERT) roles and responsibilities as assigned Comply with all Enerflex HR, Quality, HSE, and all the Company policies, procedures, processes, work instructions and guidelines Perform all other duties as assigned by Supervisor / Manager Job Skills, Qualifications and Experiences Minimum a technical degree in Industrial Processes, Chemical, Petroleum or equivalent 0-2 years of experience in a similar role within the Oil & Gas sector Familiar with plant equipment, processes, and all ongoing activities. General troubleshooting, problem-solving, information analysis, and interpersonal skills General understanding of Plant PFDs, P & IDs, drawings, Cause & Effect matrix, and Fire & Gas detection system philosophy Basic understanding of Maintenance Management System (Work orders, Preventive/Corrective/and Predictive Maintenance) methodology Computer proficiency is mandatory. Good working knowledge of typical Microsoft suite of software is required. Good interpersonal and communication skills. Good English command, written and spoken. Arabic is an asset. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required.An Equal Opportunity EmployerEnerflex grants equal employment opportunity to all qualified persons without regard to race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, genetic information, mental or physical disability, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law. Equal employment opportunities are provided in recruitment, hiring, promotions, wages, benefits, and other terms, conditions and privileges of employment. Enerflex

title: Senior Electrical Designer OHL
description: Building on our past. Ready for the futureWorley is a global professional services company of energy, chemicals and resources experts. We partner with customers to deliver projects and create value over the life of their assets. We’re bridging two worlds, moving towards more sustainable energy sources, while helping to provide the energy, chemicals and resources needed now.As a Senior OHL Designer with Worley, you will work closely with our existing team to deliver projects for our clients while continuing to develop your skills and experience etc. Deliver Electrical specific design and drafting services that meet Worley, the clients and applicable statutory and regulatory requirements. Able to Conduct Site Visit for Various Project and in specific OHL Related project to identify the suitable rout for the OHL Able to work in PLSCAD Software to get the plan and profile , sag tension and stringing chart for the OHL for different voltage level starting from 33 KV till 400 KV Identify design scope based on the project definition and develop list of drawing deliverables and estimates to complete the work. Initiate and manage design & drafting assignments for projects specific requirements as per schedule and budget. Perform Electrical specific design and drafting services such as: Ensure the project scope is clear, identify change & risk with design scope and any changes to scope is recorded as per project change management processes. Interpret and interface vendor equipment and/or third-party design documents into project design. Ensure all drawings and documents are prepared and checked in accordance with Worley drafting standard and checking procedure. Participate in various project reviews as required. Undertake design and drafting assignments in line with projects requirements on time and within budget. QualificationsAbout You:To be considered for this role it is envisaged you will possess the following attributes:· Diploma in Electrical Engineering .· At least 15 years Electrical design and drafting experience in the Power , oil and gas Industry.· Experience in Brownfield electrical systems .· A good understanding International standards.· Knowledge of PDO SP STD and DEP shell STD is Plus· Highly effective technical and practical Electrical design and drafting skills.· Proven skillset in utilizing the following software and tools:· PLSCAD for OHL Design is must.· Microsoft Office and Excel· AutoCad· Lighting Software like Dialux etc· 3D Modelling software’s (E3D and/or S3D) is plus.· Effectively interface with other disciplines to ensure fit for purpose design.· Proven experience in creating electrical deliverables such as:· Plan and Profile for OHL (33KV,132 KV,220 KV and 400 KV)· Sag Tension and Stringing Chart for OHL (33KV,132 KV,220 KV and 400 KV)· OHL Desktop Study for OHL route Identification· Single line diagrams – HV and LV· OHL Routing layout· Preparation of Protection & Metering Drgs· Cable schedule· Material take offs· Electrical Equipment / Switchroom layouts· Lighting calculation (Dialux) & Lighting Layout· Power and Cable Routing layouts· Panel general arrangements· 3D Modelling of Electrical Equipment, Cable Trays / Trenches / Raceways, Lighting· Excellent verbal and written communications skills, including the ability to clearly convey information and ideas to project team members.Moving forward togetherWe’re committed to building a diverse, inclusive and respectful workplace where everyone feels they belong, can bring themselves, and are heard. We provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants and employees without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by law.We want our people to be energized and empowered to drive sustainable impact. So, our focus is on a values-inspired culture that unlocks brilliance through belonging, connection and innovation.And we're not just talking about it; we're doing it. We're reskilling our people, leveraging transferable skills, and supporting the transition of our workforce to become experts in today's low carbon energy infrastructure and technology.Whatever your ambition, there’s a path for you here. And there’s no barrier to your potential career success. Join us to broaden your horizons, explore diverse opportunities, and be part of delivering sustainable change. Worley

title: Sales Force Developer / Admin
description: We are seeking an experienced and highly skilled Salesforce Developer / Administrator to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of Salesforce architecture and be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining our Salesforce platform. This role will also include administrative responsibilities such as user management, system configuration, and data integrity.Key Responsibilities:Development: Design, develop, and deploy custom Salesforce solutions using Apex, Visualforce, Lightning Components, and other technologies. Build scalable and efficient applications that meet business requirements. Integrate Salesforce with other internal and third-party applications. Create and manage custom objects, fields, formulas, validation rules, and workflow automation. Develop custom reports, dashboards, and analytics. Administration: Perform system configurations, user setups, role management, and permission sets. Maintain data integrity and data governance, including data cleansing and deduplication. Monitor system performance and troubleshoot issues. Manage sandbox environments and deploy changes between environments. Ensure system security by implementing best practices and regular audits. Collaboration: Work closely with business stakeholders to understand requirements and translate them into technical specifications. Collaborate with other IT team members to ensure seamless integration and optimization. Document technical designs, configurations, and user instructions. Required Skills & Qualifications: Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field. Salesforce Administrator Certification (ADM 201) required. Salesforce Platform Developer I Certification preferred. 3+ years of experience in Salesforce development and administration. Proficiency in Apex, Visualforce, SOQL, and Lightning Web Components. Experience with integration tools (e.g., REST/SOAP APIs, MuleSoft, Data Loader). Strong understanding of Salesforce best practices and security models. Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Strong communication and interpersonal skills. Preferred Qualifications: Salesforce Platform Developer II Certification. Experience with Agile methodologies and tools (e.g., Jira, Confluence). Knowledge of CPQ, Marketing Cloud, or Service Cloud is a plus. Understanding of CI/CD processes and tools. Info Resume Edge

description: Key Responsibilities:Design, develop, and implement customizations and integrations in Microsoft Dynamics 365 (F&O / CE).Work with stakeholders to gather requirements and translate business needs into functional D365 solutions.Customize and extend D365 using plugins, workflows, Power Automate, and custom applications.Create and maintain technical documentation, including solution architecture and user guides.Develop and maintain integrations with external systems using APIs, OData, and Azure services.Troubleshoot, debug, and resolve technical issues in D365 applications.Participate in system upgrades, data migrations, and performance tuning.Collaborate with functional consultants, business analysts, and QA teams.Follow SDLC and agile development methodologies.Ensure solutions adhere to Microsoft best practices, compliance, and security standards.Required Skills & Qualifications:Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.3+ years of experience developing on Microsoft Dynamics 365 (F&O, CE).Proficiency in X++, C#, .NET, JavaScript, and SQL Server.Experience with Power Platform: Power Apps, Power Automate, and Power BI.Strong knowledge of Dynamics 365 SDK, custom workflows, plugins, and web resources.Experience with Azure Logic Apps, Azure Functions, and Azure DevOps.Understanding of business processes in finance, supply chain, or sales is a plus.Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.Preferred Qualifications:Microsoft Certified: Dynamics 365 Developer Associate or relevant certifications.Familiarity with ALM (Application Lifecycle Management) tools.Experience in CI/CD pipelines and source control using Git or Azure Repos. title: FEA Engineer
description: We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented FEA (Finite Element Analysis) Engineer to join our engineering team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for performing advanced simulations and structural analyses using FEA tools to support design validation, product development, and optimization efforts across multiple projects.Key Responsibilities:Perform structural, thermal, vibration, and fatigue simulations using FEA software (e.g., ANSYS, Abaqus, Nastran).Develop and validate finite element models from CAD data.Analyze results and provide design recommendations to improve product performance, safety, and durability.Collaborate with design, test, and manufacturing teams to ensure models reflect real-world conditions.Prepare detailed technical reports and presentations for internal and external stakeholders.Stay updated with the latest industry standards and simulation techniques.Contribute to continuous improvement of simulation processes and workflows.Required Qualifications:Bachelors or Masters degree in Mechanical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, or a related field.Strong understanding of FEA principles and simulation best practices.Hands-on experience with one or more FEA software tools (e.g., ANSYS, Abaqus, HyperMesh, Nastran).Proficiency in pre-processing and post-processing techniques.Knowledge of material properties, mechanical behavior, and failure criteria.Good understanding of CAD tools (e.g., SolidWorks, CATIA, NX).Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.Effective communication and documentation skills.Our portal provides information about upcoming job openings that will be accessible to various companies for recruitment purposes. Please note that we are solely a job listing platform and do not guarantee employment or make any placement commitments.Preferred Qualifications:Experience in [Automotive / Aerospace / Electronics / Heavy Machinery / Medical Devices] industry.Exposure to scripting (e.g., Python, MATLAB) for automation of FEA tasks.Experience with CFD, crash analysis, or multi-physics simulations is a plus.Knowledge of industry standards (e.g., ASME, ISO, ASTM). title: Commis Chef
description: About Calo Calo is an app providing personalized meal plans for busy people through nutritional algorithms, built with love by chefs, nutritionists, and software engineers.Launched in Bahrain in 2019, we have since expanded to 6 countries, delivered millions of meals to our customers, and launched our very own Grab & Go Cafe concepts.We're on a noble mission to make healthy easy. We think this is one of the most important problems to tackle in our world today. We have global ambitions - no small thinking here.Role Overview We are looking for a Commis Chef to join Calo Kitchen team. title: Certification Manager (Renewable Energy)
description: Job Description :This is a full-time, on-site role as a Certification Manager located in Muscat. The Certification Manager will lead all activities related to product and factory certification, ensuring compliance with international standards such as IEC 61400, ISO 9001, and relevant regional grid and safety regulations. This role involves close collaboration with global certification bodies (e.g., DNV, TÜV, UL), technical teams, and OEM licensors to manage type certification, component certification, and factory audits. The Certification Manager will also oversee documentation control, non-conformance closure, and ensure traceability of materials and processes in accordance with certification requirements.RequirementsQualifications Proven experience (5+ years) in managing certification processes for wind turbines or similar industrial products In-depth knowledge of IEC 61400 series (including IEC 61400-1, 61400-22, and 61400-23) and certification body requirements Experience working with certification authorities such as DNV, TÜV SÜD, UL, or similar Familiarity with Quality Management Systems (ISO 9001, ISO 45001, ISO 14001) Understanding of wind turbine components, manufacturing tolerances, materials traceability, and testing protocols (static, fatigue, and dynamic) Strong project management skills and ability to lead audits and conformity assessment processes Experience in preparing and reviewing Technical Files, Design Evaluation Reports, and Manufacturing Evaluation Reports Excellent communication skills and the ability to coordinate across engineering, quality, and OEM teams Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Mechanical, Electrical, Aerospace, or Industrial Engineering Fluency in English; Arabic or Chinese is a plus Experience with type certification transfers, technology licensing, or re-certification of locally manufactured components is an advantage Green Umbrella Recruitment

title: Investment Manager - Oman
description: Are you a visionary leader with a passion for high-impact investments? Our client, a prominent institutional wealth fund, is seeking an exceptional investment manager to spearhead the strategic, financial, and operational execution of a key national fund. This new and exciting role demands an executive leader who can set bold directions, source and execute transformative investments, cultivate critical partnerships, expertly oversee a dynamic portfolio, and ensure every initiative resonates with the long-term vision.As the executive driving force, you'll be instrumental in deploying capital targets, meticulously monitoring portfolio performance, and managing the entire life cycle of assets from entry to successful exit.This role transcends traditional investment management; you will implement initiatives to unlock profound value within the portfolio. Enforce accountability with fund managers, and champion strategic governance and risk management to ensure full compliance and optimal risk-return balance. Your awareness of market trends and the ability to foster strategic alignments will be crucial in maximizing overall value and achieving diversification objectives.Our client is looking for an experienced professional with 10 to 15 years of related work experience, including a minimum of 6 years of deep technical expertise in fund management. Ideally you will have gained a career within investment banking, private equity, or project finance. A Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Finance, Economics, Accounting, or a related field is required, with a Master's degree and professional qualifications like CFA, CMA, or CPA being a significant plus.If you possess an unwavering commitment to excellence, a strategic mindset, and the drive to make a tangible difference in a nation's prosperity, please forward your resume to Aly Badran atAP Group is acting as an introductory service in relation to this vacancy. By submitting your CV for consideration, you are consenting to its retention for the purpose of securing you work. Any information you provide to AP Group and its subsidiaries will be subject to the protection of Data Protection Laws, our policy for which can be found at https://www.apgroupglobal.com/privacy-notice/ AP Executive

title: Emergency Veterinarian Relief
description: We are seeking a highly skilled and compassionate Emergency Veterinarian Relief to join our team. The ideal candidate will provide exceptional emergency care to animals during critical situations, including evenings, weekends, and holidays. This role is crucial in ensuring that pets receive immediate and effective medical attention, stabilizing conditions, and delivering expert care during emergencies.Key Responsibilities: Diagnose and treat emergency conditions in animals promptly and effectively. Perform emergency surgeries, wound management, and critical care procedures as needed. Assess animal health through physical examinations and diagnostic tests. Stabilize pets during critical situations and provide life-saving treatments. Communicate effectively with pet owners to explain diagnoses, treatment plans, and prognoses. Work collaboratively with veterinary technicians and support staff to deliver high-quality care. Maintain detailed and accurate medical records of patients. Ensure compliance with all veterinary medical standards, policies, and regulations. Qualifications: Doctor of Veterinary Medicine (DVM) degree from an accredited institution. Valid veterinary license in the state of [Specify State]. Minimum of [Specify Years] years of experience in emergency or critical care settings preferred. Proficient in emergency medical procedures and diagnostics. Ability to handle high-stress situations with compassion and professionalism. Skills & Competencies: Strong diagnostic skills and attention to detail. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to work independently and make critical decisions under pressure. Compassion for animals and dedication to their well-being. Proficiency in medical record-keeping and practice management software. Working Conditions: Requires working evenings, weekends, and holidays as needed. Fast-paced, emergency clinic or hospital environment. Ability to lift up to 50 lbs and stand for extended periods. Exposure to distressed animals, infectious diseases, and hazardous materials. Info Resume Edge

title: Commis Butcher - Six Senses Zighy Bay
description: Job Category: Brand ManagementJob Description:As Commis Butcher, I will fully comprehend the vision of Six Senses to help people reconnect with themselves, others and the world around them and our values of local sensitivity and global sensibility, crafted experiences, emotional hospitality, responsible and caring, fun and quirky and pioneering wellness.Sustainability, Wellness and Out of the Ordinary experiences are at the core of everything we do at Six Senses. I will safeguard these pillars and ensure full knowledge and active participation of all our brand initiatives. Duties and Responsibilities As Commis Butcher, I will assume full responsibility for the efficient operation in the following: Continually focus on the rejuvenation of the culinary experience. Separating the primal cuts from the carcasses, trimming, cutting and boning efficiently into required retail cuts Maintaining proper portion control when butchering retail cuts into portions Establish purchasing practices that meet the requirements of the Six Senses nutrition and sustainability platforms. Instill a cost-focused philosophy through training and education. Operate the department consistent with all legal, statutory and financial requirements and documentation, reporting systems, contractual obligations, security and safety protocols, communications, product and service standards, host management practices and budgetary controls are implemented, reviewed and maintained to ensure the successful operation of the hotel. Strictly adhere to LQA standards and guest comments. Qualifications To execute the position of Commis Butcher, I must have the required qualifications, technical skills and experience in a similar role in luxury hotels with proven results and includes the following: High school diploma or equivalent and at least 3 years kitchen experience in a full-service outlet or similar setting. Hospitality diploma/degree from a recognized hospitality school is preferred. Knowledge of the use of broiler equipment and understanding of meat and fish cookery, proficient knife skills and understand farm to table concept. Alcohol awareness certification and/or food service permit or valid health/food handler card as required by local or state government agency. I have an excellent command of written and spoken English, and I am able to live in a remote location for extended periods of time and travel on single status. The above is intended to provide an overview of the role and responsibilities for a Commis Butcher at Six Senses Zighy Bay. It is not and does not infer that the above is an inclusive and/or exhaustive list of the duties and responsibilities inherent to the position.Six Senses Zighy Bay is an equal opportunity employer. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment.About Us: At IHG, we've made a promise. As one of the world's leading hotel groups, we're here to deliver True Hospitality for Good. Making our guests and colleagues feel welcome, cared for, recognised and respected - wherever they are in the world. Want to be part of the journey?About the Team:Six Senses serves as a changemaker and maintains a leadership commitment to community, sustainability, emotional hospitality, wellness, and crafted experiences, infused with a touch of quirkiness.Whether an exquisite island resort, mountain retreat, or urban hotel; Six Senses unites a diverse, multinational, and multicultural portfolio of properties. Each host brings to life the values in their own way, while delivering on the brand's vision: to reawaken people's senses so they feel the purpose behind their travels and ultimately reconnect with themselves, others, and the world around them.You're about to be the author of this journey that takes you through life's undiscovered passageways, hidden treasures, and meaningful experiences.It's a story unlike any other. Out of the ordinary, one could say. A journey across lands and seas, a tale about what it means to connect to the world around us.Let the journey begin. IHG Hotels & Resorts

title: Assistant/Associate Professor - Logistics and Supply Chain log
description: Description:The German University of Technology in Oman (GUtech) was established in Muscat, the capital of the Sultanate of Oman in 2007 in collaboration with RWTH Aachen University in Germany and the German Academic Exchange Service (DAAD). GUtech aims to become a leading university of technology in the wider region by building on the three pillars of education, research, and innovation. Through its affiliation with RWTH Aachen University, GUtech provides students with a high-quality education, resulting in socially responsible graduates, guided by German excellence and with a firm grounding in Oman's culture and heritage. GUtech's programs of study are accredited by the German agency ACQUIN. GUtech faculty members also engage in research projects, locally, in cooperation with RWTH Aachen University, and other universities abroad.The Faculty of Business and Economics at GUtech currently offers B.Sc. programs in “International Business and Service Management” and “Logistics”, and a Master of Business Administration (MBA), and plans to further expand in this direction. A PhD programme is currently being approved.The faculty is looking for collaborative candidates with demonstrated evidence of effective teaching and research in Logistics and Supply Chain Management. Courses to be taught include Quantitative Methods and Operations Management (e.g., Procurement, Production logistics, Distribution, Transportation Logistics, Optimization and Simulation Techniques, Factory Planning, etc.). The position is available at the Assistant/Associate Professor level and will commence September 2024.Tasks & Responsibilities: Ensuring high levels of student achievement and satisfaction in under-graduate and post-graduate courses, as well as in thesis supervision Delivering well-prepared-lectures, tutorials and other forms of interactions with students, which demonstrate cultural awareness and corresponding pedagogy Implementing student-centered approaches to learning and reflective practices in teaching Providing academic support to students who need them with individualized plans Strengthening the nexus between teaching, research, and industry Commitment to continuous professional development Contributing to the development of research and consultancy projects aligned with the University's mission and strategy Building research capacity by training and co-supervising young researchers Participation in collaborative work with other universities, in Oman and abroad in multidisciplinary research Ensuring adequate knowledge transfer, e.g., through scholarly publications Promoting the values of the University, especially multicultural awareness and ethical practices Performing other tasks assigned by the University and as required. QualificationsCandidates for this position must demonstrate their compliance with the following requirements: Hold a PhD degree or equivalent in Logistics. Have strong research record as demonstrated by international publications. Possess appropriate academic professional qualifications. Teaching and industry experience in the relevant discipline is an asset. Demonstrate evidence of excellence in teaching undergraduate courses and experience in teaching postgraduate courses and supervising thesis. Experience in developing course curricula according to accreditation and international standards. Excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills. Ability to work effectively in a team-oriented multi-cultural environment. Required Documents Curriculum Vitae Motivation letter Teaching statement Research statement Three Reference letters Our OfferGUtech offers an international and dynamic environment with an extensive research network provided by RWTH Aachen University. The appointment is initially for two years and renewable, dependent on positive performance reviews. The salary is internationally competitive. Offers are subject to receiving Omani teaching and labour permits, which will be arranged by the University. Other non-financial benefits such as Air Tickets, Private Health Insurance, Children Education Allowance may be provided if applicable based on the university rules. GUtech

title: field Operator I
description: Responsible for assisting in the safe and efficient operation of the plant to support production targets. Perform routine operational tasks under supervision, ensuring safety and procedural standards compliance. Communicate effectively with team members and supervisors to maintain reliable and trouble-free operations..Principle Duties & Responsibilities Assist in operating and monitoring process equipment ensuring compliance with safety standards Monitor and record equipment operational parameters in the field, reporting abnormalities to the Control Room Operator (CRO) or Supervisors Support system start-ups and shutdowns as directed by supervisor Assist in pressurizing and depressurizing equipment and pipelines when required Regularly check pressure, delta pressure, temperature, and level gauges, reporting irregularities to the CRO Follow instructions from the CRO or Supervisors to maintain stable plant operations and support production optimization Adhere to QHSE standards and procedures (e.g., LOTO, PTW, TBT, JHA) and ensure proper documentation of tasks Participate in training and reviews of operational procedures, offering basic feedback for improvement Conduct basic operational and maintenance checks (daily, weekly, monthly) under supervision Assist in preparing equipment for maintenance, including isolation, draining, and decontamination Ensure accurate and timely handover of information to the next shift team Identify and report unsafe conditions to supervisors. Safely handle and top up chemicals, lubricants, and coolants, collecting samples as directed Maintain housekeeping and cleanliness standards during and after tasks Comply with Emergency Response Team (ERT) roles and responsibilities as assigned Comply with all Enerflex HR, Quality, HSE, and all the Company policies, procedures, processes, work instructions and guidelines Perform all other duties as assigned by Supervisor / Manager Job Skills, Qualifications and Experiences Minimum a technical degree in Industrial Processes, Chemical, Petroleum or equivalent 0-2 years of experience in a similar role within the Oil & Gas sector Familiar with plant equipment, processes, and all ongoing activities. General troubleshooting, problem-solving, information analysis, and interpersonal skills General understanding of Plant PFDs, P & IDs, drawings, Cause & Effect matrix, and Fire & Gas detection system philosophy Basic understanding of Maintenance Management System (Work orders, Preventive/Corrective/and Predictive Maintenance) methodology Computer proficiency is mandatory. Good working knowledge of typical Microsoft suite of software is required. Good interpersonal and communication skills. Good English command, written and spoken. Arabic is an asset. Motivated, team player, able to work within a diverse cultural environment, willing to learn Enerflex
